reviewDescription: I read the reviews and expected to get a great vacuum cleaner with an amazing suction power. So many people praised it and said it surprised them with how powerful it was. Unfortunately, I was disappointed. It sucks but not in a good way. It takes a lot of moves over the same spot to clean it. It misses a lot of dirt, even on the hardwood floors, and especially so on the carpet.But why did I decide to keep it?1. Because it still does its job. Yes, a regular vacuum is still needed once a week, but this one is okay for everyday, not-so-perfect cleaning. I can definitely feel the difference under my bare feet. I will be using it every day to clean the bathroom's floor where my cat's toilet is placed (and for other rooms too).2. It's super lightweight. This is crucial to me. If it was too heavy to move, I would be too lazy to use it often. But this thing can be held with one hand! I think even a child or an older person can use it with ease.3. It's slim and can be placed somewhere in a corner. I keep my regular vacuum in a closet, but this little one can be stored somewhere in a hall or a room, which makes it convenient to use whenever I want.4. Easy to empty the trash.5. There is nothing better for the price. More powerful models cost $100+, so I decided this one does its job fairly well and I'm keeping it.UPDATE: okay I’m changing my opinion. Initially I gave this item 3/5 stars, now I gave it 4 stars and even think it deserves 5 stars, but there are minor objective cons.The cons: the sound is pretty loud; the suction power is mild.Other than that, it’s an amazing vacuum that solves all my issues with chores. I really needed this thing. It’s so lightweight that I sometimes use it multiple times a day, because it’s super easy to pick it up and do a quick cleaning without treating it like a hard procedure. It does its job despite being less powerful than regular vacuums. It’s thin and I put it in a corner from where it’s easy to pick it ip any time. The cord is long enough for my apartment. I’m glad I bought it, and I hope it won’t break too soon!

Love how light it is, good suction for all the dog hair and works ok on most throw rugs. Not for actual carpet, it didn't pull the hair up. Fits under cabinets very nicely. Only drawback is I REALLY wish it had a headlight. I would have paid more if it did. I'm done with the cordless vacs that continually get plugged up with hair.

This vacuum, at first look appears to be cheap. I easily assembled right out of the box and began to vacuum. Let me tell you!!! We are in a 2 bed 2 bathroom with a small long haired dog. The amount of dust,  dirt, hair and DOG HAIR was surprising. Suction from carpet to vinyl floors allowed a quick vacuum session. Easily emptied the bagless compartment twice. The only reason I don't give it 5 stars is because I am having to search for replacement filters. I didn't think about that before my purchase.  Bissell is pretty good about crossing filters and such. I am sure I'll find one, for the future. So far this was a surprisingly a great purchase.  Let's see how long it lasts.

I have been using the vacuum for just over a month. This makes vacuuming my stairs and hard floors so much easier. I do it a lot more often too because I no longer have to haul out my big vacuum and deal with the attachments and cord. On a full charge I can get my kitchen, 3 bathrooms, 2 small entryways, and my carpeted stairs done with medium speed. The battery is dead by the end. I do wish it came with 2 batteries though so I could leave one on the vacuum and one on the charger to switch out when it dies. The baterries take 3-4 hours to charge and I get about 25-30 mins from it.  It does just as good as my big vacuum on the stairs. Both my big vacuum and this one have a motorized brush attachment. It does well getting to the edge of the hard floors and picks up small debri. Something like a piece of cereal you would have to lift it a little since there is not much space between the floor nozzel and the floor. Not a huge problem for me since I am mostly vacuuming animal fur and sand. I do have a small complaint about empting the dirt cup. The filter really holds the dirt and it hard to tap the dirt out and I often make a mess around my trash can in the process. I do blow it out with our air compressor outside every couple weeks. The suction power will reduce as the filter gets dirter (I learned this after vacuuming the spider webs from my garage walls), but once full cleaned the suction power returns to normal. You can wash it in the sink, but why get it wet if I have the ability to clean it with air. I also have to use my hand to get the hair and dirt off from the metal filter.

reviewTitle: Only wish the cord was longer
reviewDescription: I bought this to help clean my classroom because 2nd graders are like mess machines and I was very pleasantly surprised. It’s way more powerful than a cordless handheld, and works great on hard floors and low classroom carpets. My only complaint is that the cord seems unusually short. I would need an extension cord to reach every part of my classroom even when I move the cord to outlets around the room to try and reach

reviewTitle: Brush Stopped Working First Use, Replacement Works Well
reviewDescription: Update from less than a week later: The replacement brush arrived spins and the vacuum seems to work well and no more messing with cords when I clean!  While the start wasn't perfect, presuming the malfunctional brush was just a fluke, I remain hopeful this is exactly what I was looking for._____________________________Initial Review: Ultimately, if it worked, this would be exactly what I need. That said, I used it for maybe 10 minutes after fully charging and it stopped working. After investigation that took too long for a new product, it appears to be the brush that is faulty and will not spin so the vacuum turns itself off and does not work.Bissell's chat product support has said they will be replacing the brush but notes that the brush is not under warranty. I plan to update review to see if the next brush lasts longer, until then I am hanging onto the original packaging just in case a return is in order.

reviewTitle: Good value, though I expected more power based on other reviews
reviewDescription: Got this for my child to use at university housing.  Was comparing to cordless dustbuster-types.  Figured a corded one would give more power for less money (as that has been my experience with power tools).  So, the power was not really what I expected. Granted, one does not have to worry about loss of power with age as one would for a cordless.  And at $30, it's still a bargain.

Looks  like a dust buster with a stick. I was worried when i first opened the box.Easy to assemble and much more powerful than I imagined. I use on rugs,floor, and one room which has carpet .Picks up everything! Perfect for my needs. Only faults are the handle is a bit too short and it requires a little muscle to push on carpet. Also jumps a little on carpet .

Editing my review. Initially I couldn’t believe how poorly this vacuum worked. I wrote a long, in depth review about it. I had already started a return, but, before I boxed it up I decided to give it one more chance. I realized the canister was in the position to empty, at approximately a 45 degree angle from the stick “backbone.” (see photos for reference) I clicked it in before starting my second attempt around the house and it had so much suction that I could only use the lowest setting on my low pile washable rugs and even then it was lifting them up at times. I say this to mean, it was my OPERATOR ERROR the first go round that resulted in hardly any dirt, dust, or dog hair being picked up. I can’t help but wonder if many of the others who gave low ratings had the same problem. It picked up super fine dust and dander from our living room and I’m excited to run it again. Cons: 1) It always starts in medium mode and has to go to turbo before you can switch to low. 2) There is no option to turn the roller bar off on the foot attachment. 3) It is quite top heavy so make sure you lean it against something. 4) The foot attachment does not click into an upright position. I deducted 1 star for the above reasons. All in all, I am satisfied with the purchase.

Pros: 1) very lightweight 2) suction is much better than several other comparables I triedCons: 1) if you’re over 5’5”, you’ll find it uncomfortable because it’s short2) the cord is only long enough for a small room 3) the area that actually sucks dirt is only 2” long (as shown in photos), so don’t expect it to substitute for a regular sized vacuum, but rather picture an electric broom that works okay on carpet.Overall, nice for hard floors and can use in place of normal vacuuming when you have a quick clean up. Great for vacuuming mattress pads, furniture seats etc. because it’s so lightweight. Would be MUCH better if it wasn’t under sized.

This is my second time buying this. I gave one to my friend when I moved and just bought another one for myself. I had the other one for 4 years and it still worked perfectly, but I drove across the country so just thought I’d buy a new one. It’s SUPER easy to put together and to take apart if you want to use just the hand held. The attachments work perfectly to get into tight spaces. It’s light and durable, so it’s good for anyone who doesn’t need a heavy duty vacuum. My dog doesn’t shed and I have hardwood and carpet and this works great for those. It’s also a very cute color! So if you don’t need to vacuum up after kids and heavily shedding animals, I’d say stop reading this and click “add to cart” and thank me later.

It’s the incredible combination of features this vacuum has that makes me love it.  (1) super lightweight.  So much so that i can lift it or slip it past heavy furniture into skinny spaces to do its job.  (2) strong suction.  Highly effective vacuum force for wood floor or rugs.  (3) uses AC instead of charger.  Yes, cordless is an attractive feature.  HOWEVER, this cord is light and easy to move; not a chore as with most heavier vacuums.  Most importantly,  the suction force is consistently powerful, no fading battery, making my job easier and more efficient for as long as i need it. (4) Low price.  Hands down the best value in vacuums I’ve ever found.  Forget you Dyson.  I love this product. Got it for my daughter’s new apartment.  Now going to get one for my home. It’s just too easy to use and too good of a value not to have for myself.

I am in love with this vacuum cleaner. I had a Bissell Featherweight Stick that was about 10 years old. I used it all the time. I had to replace it only because the flap that keeps dirt and debris within the canister dry rotted. I bought the updated version never imagining how much better it would be than the old version. It has a lot of suction power for smaller particles. I experimented by vacuuming my screen b porch and it did an incredible job. It is lightweight and easy to maneuver. It swivels better and fits better under furniture than the older model. I like the placement of the filter and dirt doesn't go everywhere when I'm cleaning it out. I also really like that you can buy replacement filters.  I'm buying ones for my adult children.

reviewTitle: Great Cleaning and Vacuuming power from the Bissel Stick Vac
reviewDescription: I will say out right this little Bissel Stick Vac does and excellent job in cleaning and is much more vacuuming pick up power than I had figured on.  The first day I used my Bissel Stick Vac it performed very well out of the box.  I live in a 2 bedroom apartment, with a small living room and a kitchen with linoleum floor.  It is an older-building constructed back in 1965 according property tax records.  So the outside structure is failing apart. I live on the top floor of this 2 floor apartment complex with 19 units in total. The apartments are not enclosed so the upper concrete walk way has railings and covered by protective awnings but open air design still exposure to wind, rain, sunlight and other elements.Anyways the amount of dust and dirt the Bissel Vac picked up was amazing.  The filter was literally caked with dust and dirty like a dirty snowball or Cotton Candy you find at a carnival vendor. Believe me I keep my apartment clean as a matter of principle, so I mop and clean on a daily basis so things do not accumulate. I could dust more but this unit I live in does NOT  have central A/C or Heating.  This apartment is cooled and heated by mounted wall units. The A/C unit is permanently mount half way from the inner wall to the outside ear my front door. It is an older model and NOT very energy efficient by todays standard. However it is  closed end unit, meaning it only circulates air that is drawn from within the apartment itself and NOT in-taking Air directly from the outside of the apartment.  The outside portion of the Wall A/C is mainly to house the compressor and cooling mechanism units where the refrigeration gases are stored. As well as provide for heat exhaust and exchange for the mechanism itself when in operation. (Sorry do not mean to get off the subject but I just wanted to give potential buyers for the Bissel Stick Vac an idea of the real world environment this product is performing in).The Bissel's motor and housing assembly also contain the detachable canister where the debris is collected, until the receptacle is cleaned out. The unit is light weight, so it is easy to maneuver in tight areas and is perfect for carpeted or hard floor steps.  The Bissel also detaches and as 1 extra attachment a long straight non-flexible nozzle which is great for cleaning the edges of floorboards or hard to reach areas or tight corners that a normal vacuum may not reach.  As far as cleaning under couch furniture cushions and around the bed areas where dust and dirt tends to collect around the post or caster feet of the frames or Chest of drawers it does a smash up job in quickly cleaning those hard to reach areas. However the straight non-flexible attachment is NOT very long just maybe 1 foot in length so you will not be able to reach areas that are more than an adults arm length to reach.I have lived nearly 2 years in this current apartment, and the edges of my matted carpet and floorboards have never been cleaner than after using the Bissel Stick Vac.  The roommate I had before this was lazy and did not vacuum him self a all. So I inherited a rather dirty apartment by my standards , when he moved out earlier last year. I just hope I do not find any other "hidden" damage in the unit that he is responsible for before I moved in.To get to the point here my summary of the Bissel Stick Vac model 2033.PROS1. Very good value for the money2. For a small stick Vac it has incredible cleaning power, it truly picked up much of the dirt, dust that is ground in  to this carpet. (Obviously this carpet has not been shampooed in quite some time by the previous tenants  which means not in the last 5-7 years give the tenant history of this unit.)3.  Very Light weight unit, easy to use and get into tight or difficult areas where you may not be able to move  heavier furniture by yourself.  (So it is perfect gift for perhaps older or senior or people with health issues who  can not use a heavier vacuum. As well as College Students who are always on the go or committed to their  studies and have little time to spare. since it makes cleaning easier and will give students an incentive to NOT  neglect their living areas and take 10- 15 mins just to tidy up on a daily basis.)4. This is my personal favorite feature. NO infamous rubber drive belt to worry about. Those Serpentinian drive  belts, which are on traditionally  Upright vacuum rollers. Which if you have ever had to change a drive belt out  it can be a messy and  unpleasant chore; as well as expensive. Since many vacuum drive belts can be expensive  as well as difficult to find if the unit is older or the model has been discontinued.5. Easy storage , as the Bissel Stick Vac has a standard power cord which will roll up on the bracket handles and  store away easily in a coat closet which may many large heavy coats that make reaching into the back of the  closet difficult. It takes up very little space when you need to store it while not in use!6. Easy clean up and maintenance! The dirt container easily detaches from the mounting clips so you may access the small HEPA filter and dump all the Dirt ad Debris into the garbage. The unit is also good for picking smaller objects like paper clips or push pins or even small coins in the event you accidently knock over some from your office desk and do not want to throw the items away and they may have spilled all over the place. Since the Debris the vacuum picks up does not pass through the motor itself and NO moving parts like rollers near the vacuums nozzel  so the will not jam and cause the motor to overheat or cause a short circuit because the motor has seized which is a definite fire hazard! The Dirty canister is placed in before the motor assembly and has a solid filter so no small debris like nuts, bolts, small screws or paperclips can enter into the vacuum's motor housing itself.CONS1). The dirt collection container ahs a small capacity so if you use it as the "main" vacuum cleaning tool, then you will need clean it out thoroughly depending on how dirty the floor is or what you are vacuuming up.  As a general of thumb this vacuum is best suited for smaller apartments that have no more than 2-3 rooms with a matted or shallow carpet. I would NOT recommend this vacuum for high pyled, shag or very high-end expensive carpets. NOR would I recommend this vacuum as the main tool for houses with more than 3 rooms. Though it does a excellent job for small chores or detail work around difficult tight corners or heavier furniture;. You will want a more traditional vacuum with a 30 AMP motor or better if you live in a large home or have a carpet or floor that is notoriously harder to vacuum.2) The floor nozzle assembly does NOT have any special in-take or moving bristles to collect suborn dirty, dust  or debris, which ironically lends itself to the light weight of the Bissel Stick Vac which allows the user to  maneuver the floor nozzle so the in-take can vacuum the dirt and debris up. You can also detach the unit from  the handle and use it like a hand held dust buster like vacuum and use the nozzle attachment to get to the  floorboard edges and tight corners  So if you are vacuuming in a flat straight line you will need to on an open  carpet or floor you will need to use a technique that will cover the smaller width of the active cleaning area of  the floor nozzle when you do use the unit as it will NOT vacuum wide swaths  of carpet or floor when the  vacuum is in use. Which makes it a bit safer to use around plugged in power cords ad power strip-surge  protectors in a home or small office settings. The power cords will not be entangled in power rollers which  could cause severe damage to the vacuum the office equipment and a strong possibility of electrocution to the  operator.+++++++++++++++++++++ Summary of the Bissel Stick Vac Model 2033 ******************************I would recommend buying this product for small chores or if you live in building with a simple floor plan with no more than 3 bedrooms or does NOT have a plush, or expensive carpets like a real Perishing rug! That would be insane! That would be like using an SOS steel wool pad on a Rembrandt or Vincent Van Gogh painting!  Which would be INSANE! It is a great cleaning tool for the money and an excellent value for the price I paid!

I got this vacuum today and I am surprised. It felt cheap and flimsy out of the box but man does it do the job well. cleaned up all the dirt, hair, and debris on the floor easily. even bigger chunks get picked up well but you may have to lift up slightly so I can grab it. It is really simple to use and to clean. small enough to store in tight spots too but not too small where its uncomfortable to use. overall really good item

reviewTitle: Had for 6 years! Great lightweight vacuum
reviewDescription: I wanted to write an appreciation post for this little vacuum.  Its lightweight, easy to clean and does a decent job for its size.The crevice adapter is very useful! The main roller vacuum is great for multiple surfaces - carpet, tiles, vinyl planking.Its so easy to bring around my whole condo because its so lightweight.  Cleaning it out is so easy just shake the filter over a trash can or with a more intense clean run under the faucet and dry out or just replace it.I also have a Bissell Crosswave which I also love for a deeper clean (its a wet/dry vacuum) but I spend so much time cleaning it so I love the Featherweight for its simplicity. I actually used it to vacuum out my fireplace- I don't recommend this, and my vacuum stopped working but I opened it up and cleaned it out and its good as new.

I am an 'all or it's not getting done' kind of person - that is my conditioning. One from which I suffer enormously, because the free time I get from not vacuuming the floor, washing the dishes, folding the clothes, taking a shower, eating food, drinking enough water, is spent in a state of incompleteness, dissatisfaction and self-reproach. It kills my joy and creativity.Over the years I have practiced myself into feeling good if my environment is neat, clean, tasks are complete, I smell good, and I'm fed.But not having the motivation to complete a task to perfection, every time I attempt the task, is my everyday reality.For example, I have one of the best vacuum cleaners that I could afford (a differnt one than the one I'm reviewing), which, if I spent a solid 2 hours, can deeply clean most of the floor surfaces in my house.That vacuum cleaner requires manual labor -  it's heavy, it does not self-propel, it's clunky, and I have to store it in the garage becuase it is also big. But, it cleans thoroughly.I dread getting it out of the garage and working it. I dread having to work around the fringe work on my rugs and pom poms on my curtains - because it chews those up and I end up crying for destroying something that I bought with love. This isn't a sustainable or nurturing mental space for me.I tried many different ways to shift my perspective. Saying things to myself like "That's privilege talking. You are not cleaning the floors and washing clothes by hand. Are you? So get off your butt and do it" Believe it or not, replacing shame with more shame doesn't work.I have noticed that I get the same dopamine and serotonin hits if my floors are clean, regardless of if they are deeply clean or not.So I invested in thi,s a lightweight vacuum, that ways like a broom. No batteries to charge. Does not do deep cleaning but picks up all the visible crumbs, loose threads, the feather from my down pillow, my hair, and lot of dust. And I look around and see that the floors are clean. I wrap the cord around it when done, and stick it in the hallway closet. No lugging it to the garage.That is all I need to feel motivated enough to do the next thing. Which is, fold that 1 basket of laundry, not both the baskets that are waiting for me. Which then motivates me to at least empty the dishwasher and put those dishes away. Which then motivates me to eat before I pass out, regardless of whether it's a wholesome meal or not.I thought I'd share this in case there are a few of you who are struggling with starting tasks, because you expect it to be hard, because some of these tasks are harder when added on to all the other daily responsibilities.This little vacuum sweeper is a one of my best friends.

I bought this vacuum because I live in a small apartment and thought it would be better for tight spaces than my canister vacuum.  It's a simple tool, for which the technology existed in mid-twentieth century or earlier, if you don't count advances in plastic (by the way, the bright blue plastic is very cheerful).  It's basically a plug-in hand-held vacuum, a good strong one, with a foot and a stick handle attached.  (They used to call these "electric brooms.")  It doesn't have a bag; you have to open it up and empty the cavity and brush off the filter just about every time you use it. Because it is really just a glorified hand-held vacuum, you have to bend over to switch it on.  There is a fifteen-foot cord which wraps around two hooks for storage.  Simple!  Unpretentious!However, in spite of its almost primitive simplicity--or maybe because of it?--I like it a lot.  For one thing, it is lightweight and small; it isn't a production to get it out and use it.  It cleans quite well, though it doesn't get all the cat hair off my rug--but good enough for a quick cleanup.  Emptying the vacuumed-up dirt is a dusty job, but it only takes a minute and it is instant gratification: you can see how much you vacuumed up!  The 15-foot cord enables me to vacuum my stairs and even the mat at the bottom. Yes, I have to wind the cord up when I put the vacuum away, but again that takes only a minute.  And by the way, you can use it for the couch or the car if you make use of it as a hand-held vacuum.It's true that here is no comparison between this and the spiffy cordless vacuums now available.  It's a throwback to a simpler time.  But the fancy vacuums cost much more--and are likely to be heavier.  The floor attachment on this one doesn't swivel; I wish it did, but still, I can get into small places fairly well.All in all, I kinda love it.  I'm betting it lasts longer than a rechargeable one would, and I feel quite smug about having spent so little on it.  (It was only $33 when I bought it, and at the time of this writing it's several dollars less, even.)  You really can't go too far wrong on this product!

reviewTitle: Can't express how much I love this vacuum!
reviewDescription: I just got rid of 95% of the carpet in my house (I replaced the old carpet on my stairs with carpet, but the rest is now gone).  I wanted a lightweight vacuum to keep upstairs so I didn't have to lug my other one back and forth up the stairs.  I saw this on Amazon on sale and it was so cheap I decided to try it.  I am happy I did.  I love this vacuum so much.  It weighs practically nothing so even if I use it both upstairs and down, it isn't an issue to carry it.  I am using it on vinyl plank and the suction works great.  I have used it on my new carpet on my stairs and it worked well there. I don't think it is heavy-duty enough to be a whole-house primary vacuum, nor would it be good for a house with mostly carpet.  The dustbin is very small, which makes it better for light, daily vacuuming.  It has a long cord, which is nice.  It also can be converted to a small hand-held vac. It is so easy to use this vacuum that I know I will use it so much more frequently than I have been using my old one.  Looking forward to a cleaner house!

I'm moving into my first apartment and needed the cheapest, best quality household items I could find. I usually only buy products if the reviews are at least 4.5 stars, but I risked the 4.3 stars on this vacuum. It works GREAT on any type of floors (I used it on hardwood and tiles), and even on rugs. I saw some reviews saying it doesn't pick up dirt off the floor or off of carpet, and either that was just a faulty vacuum, or there's an error on the user's end. My mom and I are VERY picky when it comes to cleaning appliances, and we love this vacuum. It really is lightweight- my mom has difficulty lifting some heavier objects, and had no issue with this one. She wants one now too!If you have thick carpet and a full family with pets, then no, maybe this isn't the right vacuum for you. I have a 650 sq. ft. studio apartment with bedroom carpet and hardwood floors, and the vacuum works perfectly for my purposes.
It doesn’t have much power but it gets the job done for a quick daily cleaning. Battery doesn’t last that long.
second time purchased . Its lightweight and quality make it ideal for small studio and 1 bedroom apartments that are carpeted.

Decent for the price. I only use it on hardwood, tile, and flat rugs, so I can’t speak to suction beyond that. However, we have a long haired dog that sheds a lot and it does well picking up fur, crumbs, debris from the surfaces listed above. Good secondary vacuum for quick cleanup.
Easy To use and decent quality. Could have higher suction. Wish it could reach on to smaller Spaces
small compact, works well for light use, easy to et  quick pick ups. Would buy again

The vacuum does an amazing job at picking up dirt and hair hidden in the carpet or on tile, I would buy it again. The only reason that this is 4 stars is because I feel that the container can get clogged easy but it is simple to empty and clean.

It's fine. Is it the best vacuum-no, but for under $35- I'm not sure what other reviewers expected. I was afraid to buy with so many negative reviews but mine works fine-picks up the stray q-tip, etc. I've had no problems with it, have just throw rugs.

I've used this for over four years on a daily basis for about 20 minutes on both a hard surface floor and some carpeted areas cleaning up after the litter my cats carry off in their paws.  For the economical price, I can't complain much.  It could be a little more powerful, but again for the price...Two minor complaints.  As others have said the cord is way too short for even an average size room.  I have a 12 foot extension cord permanently attached to it.  The other is that Bissell didn't seem to think it would be nice to have a place to store the nozzle attachment.  I solved that by Velcroing it to the front of the unit.And finally, my unit is starting to show its age in making a strange noise when turned on.  I think the motor is on the way out.  So I'm buying another one.

I am in love with this!! I have recommended it to 3 people who then purchased it. I have 3 dogs and my house needs vacuumed every day. Vacuuming made me angry. I hate cords.  With this, I love doing it! So light. The hand held is incredible. Can't say enough about how great it works on pet hair. Carpet and hardwood. It shuts off instead of letting a throw rug get tangled in the roller. The only down side would be the battery life sucks ( no pun intended). I had to ask for a backup battery as a gift because it's so expensive.

I absolutely love this vaccum the 1 thing I would change/appreciate more though is a better battery life. The vaccum overall does an amazing job with just one swipe I don't have to rock my arm back & forth so much to get a clean pickup! Slim for easy storage , can lay flat to get under the bed & suction is amazing! Cordless is always a plus ! Cleaning the filter is a breeeze and comes with an extra which was amazing! Plus the extra pieces to make cleanning easier ! Overall 9/10 just wish the battery had a longer lifespan🥰

reviewTitle: We love this- wish we'd gotten it sooner
reviewDescription: It is light weight, easy to clean and versatile - just the attachments you want. The battery lasts for all our area rugs + the couch. Charging is easily done, and the onboard headlight means it is lighting up weaxtly where you're working, so not much gets missed. Five stars!

It is like a toy lightweight but powerful!! Sucks up all the pet hair... and we have a LOT!!Great for small areas.If you need to cover more space, you will need an extention cord cause the cord it comes with  is very very short!

Nice value. Small, so stores well. Quick and easy to grab and go. Easy to keep clean. Wish it was cordless. Then it would be perfect! Great to use on the hardwood floors and the kitchen tile. Good suction, just don’t even bother on carpet.

I love the lightweight of this vacuum and the job it does. Picks up a lot of dog hair on wood floorsthat you can't even see. Does an amazing job. Love it. So much easier than a big vacuum and doesa fantastic job.

This works well on woods and stone floors but is not so great for carpets. It picks up hair and dust effectively from the floor (non carpeted). On carpets it takes effort but its works. Its a good product for a good price.

Have been trying to find a powerful vacuum to clean carpet on stairs for a LONG time.I found it!  It had to be lightweight and still do the job of a big heavy one.The BISSELL Featherweight Stick works great!
Love the color, the ease of use, the light weight of it.Does a great job of cleaning my laminate and tile floors.Also great on my area rugs.I don't have any wall to wall carpet.Perfect for my needs.

I didn't want a huge vacuum for my apartment. I'm low maintenance and have a black lab so needed something light. My favorite feature is that I can use the hand-held part to suck up her fur balls. Works great.

This vacuum was a lifesaver. I bought to replace a broom and mainly to clean up around cat litter box while traveling. I love it so much I use it every day. It works great for sweeping sand and things off flat flooring surfaces and on my low flat decorative rugs. Even picks up the pet hair! It would not be ideal for regular vacuuming on carpet especially if it was a shag or high pile carpet. I added a $5 generic extension cord to mine so I can go all over the house without replugging. My whole family all bought these as well and are also thrilled and use them daily. They do only hold a little but since they plug in and aren't battery powered they have a fair amount of power/suction and are easy to clean out just click little button to snap apart, pull little filter out, dump and voila!
This is the perfect vacuum for hard wood & tile floors. I hate using a broom cause dust flies everywhere. With this vacuum I can do all the floors & also my sofa & mattress. Great buy & saves time.

I was so excited to finally get on the 'cordless' vacuum train. I have a cat and am constantly needing to vacuum up his fur and litter trails - but this freaking vacuum is useless. Here are the problems:1. I charged the battery all night and within 5 minutes it had lost one of its charges (the display shows three dots for fully charged. after 5 minutes it was down to 2)2. Its suction power is terrible. Even on the max power, it was unable to pick up any dirt or anything in corners.3. It's super top heavy and uncomfortable to use. If you lean it against something for a minute it will easily fall over.4. Worst of all - whenever I pick it up, tons of stuff falls out of it. Aka, I need to vacuum again just to pick up what it leaks.Idk if my product is defective or if this is just a bad vacuum, but I really hate it lol. I dont know if I can return it after using it but I hate it. I'm going back to my dirt devil.I strongly do NOT recommend this product.

reviewTitle: Can't handle a bedroom with cats and a bird
reviewDescription: Ho boy, I bought this dude since I was strapped on cash and needed something to pick up the standard debris from not only two cats, but a bird as well.It's been... tiresome to say the least. It's easy to use, thankfully, but just not have thr size or power to even begin to acceptably tackle this task.I exclusively use it in my small, carpeted bedroom (no bigger than 12 by 12 with a corner cut out to accommodate the bathroom on that shared wall) and I have to go over it about 10 times (and that's not hyperbole or exaggeration, literally 10 or more) and it still doesn't get the job done 100%. And I vacuum at least once a week.I thought the small size would be find for just my little space, but it just done have the power to fluff my carpet much less remove all the dust, hair and debris from the bird, the cats and the litter box (and I use silica litter, so the dust management is hyper critical if I want to avoid respiratory problems).To illustrate my problem, I will see a small tuft of hair in the carpet and despite running the vacuum (with the floor attachment equiped) over it a dozen or more times (and the tuft being pushed around back and forth) it still can't pick it up. I empty the compartment every time I pass over a small area just incase it's impeding airflow that much (which I presume it is). Using this thing can be a miserable experience.Unfortunately, I'm still suffering through a tight financial situation, so I haven't the money to replace it with something beefier. I guess I'm stuck with it for the time being where it is honestly better to remove all attachments and run over every square in of carpet with the bare nozzle angled just perfectly so it creates maximum suction on the carpet to remove as much mess from my carpet as it'd physically capable of. I'd rather do that than vacuum my room 10+ times with worse results. There always seems to be more hair for it to pick up, no matter how many times I empty it or how many passes I make. It can never get it all.

reviewTitle: Super hard to clean house with it all in 1 go.
reviewDescription: I love all my other Bissell products. I have had a green machine, powerbrush pet stain eraser and a powerlift pet upright vaccuum. All of them work great. (Green machine was my least favorite but still worth the money and did the job!)This vaccuum though? Definitely a flop for me. I was so disappointed. The lightweightness, amount of attachments, and cordless aspects are the only pros I found. The battery is super short lived, god forbid you use the power higher. Worst part of the battery is it takes forever to charge compared to its puny time it lasts. It makes it nearly impossible to finish vacuuming my sectional or the house all in one go. I wish I could say it'd be great for small messes, but it doesn't even have decent suction power most of the time. It's alright and I can get them cleaned up, but it's almost more effective or convenient to clean up small messes with a broom. For being a pet marketed vaccuum, it definitely doesn't meet those expectations. I made sure I frequently cleaned and emptied the vaccuum as well thinking maybe it'd clog or lose suction even before reaching the max line, but still didn't help. I tried giving a bit longer than usual of a test run too to see if maybe it was me.I knew the review were mixed but I figured I'd risk it and trust the brands name and my experience with other products by them. I regret doing so now. I might try finding a spare battery or two to try to make this more tolerable, but I hate having to drop even more money on a brand new product that is far from efficient.

I have always bought Bissell products because I’ve always been happy with them and they constantly support the homeless dog shelters. I was so excited to get this vacuum. It was a horrible disappointment!!!  It is a very good vacuum if you live in apartment in a big city with no kids and no pets but as you can see it has a horrible design flaw. The dirt return goes through a very small space and cannot possibly pick up anything but dust. There isn’t room for anything but dust to go into the canister. I constantly had to take it apart and pull the hair and dirt out and stuff it into the canister myself. I had waited a long time to get one and I was terribly disappointed that it was so poorly designed. Once again, not for anyone with kids or pets. 🥹

This product says you can remove the spinning brush inside the foot piece to clean it, however, once removed, cleaned, and replaced, the brush becomes incapable of ever moving inside the machine again. This happened twice. The brush became stuck inside the foot of the machine and was unable to spin making the machine unusable. When I would turn the machine on, it would recognize that the brush was stuck and not spinning inside the foot of the machine and would instantly turn off.  The first time this occurred, Bissell sent me a replacement footplate and then completely replaced the machine the second time. Overall, I think this machine is poorly designed and I wish I could just completely return the machine a buy a different brand but I have to settle for a replacement machine from Bissell as the machine was still under warranty.

I was excited to get a “name brand” cordless vacuum after my off brand one that I bought here on Amazon finally died. I had it for 3 years and didn’t really have any complaints but was happy to get what I thought would be an upgrade. I have been so dissatisfied with this Bissell and unfortunately I have been too busy to return it and missed the return window. So now I’m stuck with it. :( The suction is good. No complaints there but the battery life is appalling. I have a one bedroom apartment and I have to charge it after vacuuming each area (living, dining, kitchen, hall, bathroom, bedroom). Even doing that it completely died on me before getting to the bathroom and bedroom today so it seems that after only 6 weeks the battery power is diminishing from bad to worse. It’s so frustrating. It means that doing my floors takes all day because I have to wait for the charge to come back or I have to finish them on a second day, which is so aggravating. I wouldn’t recommend this to anyone who wants to use it for anything more than to vacuum up messes. Such a bummer.

I had high hopes that this would be able to replace my Eureka stick vac but the battery life on this one was terrible.  I charged it overnight before the first use and then used it in the morning for a quick once over through the kitchen/dining area.  The suction was ok on hardwood, but really only with it on high.  I ran it on med/high, getting used to what it could do.  Going over my two doormats it needed to be on high to pick up anything.  I didn't evenbother with low setting as it seemed too weak to pick up anything.  During this first attempt, it cut off twice then died within 7minutes.  I thought maybe it hadn't charged fully so plugged it back in for ~5hours until it showed fully charged.  This time, I timed it to see how long it would last.  On a combo of med-high, it lasted less than 7 minutes.  Giving it one more chance, I tried charging it again to full battery.  And again, it lasted 6 and a half minutes.  It takes 4-5+ hours to recharge.  The attachments seemed nice but I didn't even get to use them 😕

Super excited about this vacuum - the reviews were great - but I'm not having much luck with it.  The handle is loose and makes a terrible "clacking" noise while I'm vacuuming and sometimes the unit just shuts itself off.  When it does work, the suction is great - almost TOO GREAT.  If I try and vacuum rugs it sucks them up and then shuts off.  I've given up on vacuuming rugs - I just want the "clacking" to stop and for the unit to quit shutting itself down.Really don't want to have to package and return.  Last time I returned an expensive item from Amazon, it reportedly "didn't arrive" and they charged me anyway.

As a Bissell brand, I was expecting a good value for your money. Obviously, this is a stick vacuum and normally don't come with a carpet brush on the bottom and you can't expect it to have the same sunction power as a stand right vacuum. However, all it does is collects the hair into a ball and you constantly have to pass it over and over the smallest item and it might or might not pick it up. It works better on tiles, but even on low level carpets, it does nothing. Also, the entire product is made of plastic and the power button is all the way towards the bottom. Very inconvenient.

This vacuum kinda sucks; or rather, it doesn't.  That's the issue.  There are a few good qualities though.Pros: Extremely lightweight.  Easy to use, and compact to store which makes it handy for an RV (which is what we use it for).Cons: Primary the suction, or lack thereof.  It does OK, but really not great.  I have low and no-pile rugs, and it struggles.  The cord is short, which doesn't matter in our little travel trailer, but will be important to others I'm sure.While this vacuum is quite inexpensive, I wish I chose something higher quality.

After ordering this vacuum, I went back to look at the reviews because I am frankly not impressed by this vacuum. That's when I noticed that the majority of the reviews are about a different vacuum and not the CleanView XR Pet. You can clearly see this by the pictures that people have posted. Honestly, Amazon is become less and less reliable to use.As for the vacuum. The suction power is okay. If you want to use the highest power mode, it will run out of battery in around 8 minutes and then take hours to recharge. Hair and larger debris all get stuck around the filter so emptying out the can - which is tiny and fills up very quickly - is a chore as you'll have to use your fingers to pull everything out.On top of all this, the included upholstery/pet attachment broke the minute I used it. There is a roller underneath it to help it glide over upholstery and it just popped out and broke the first time I used it, very gently mind you.Another thing I very much dislike about it, is that it will not stand up on its own and falls over very easily, even when you detach the vacuum itself so you can use the attachments the extension portion falls off.Wish I'd bought a Dyson instead.

reviewTitle: Not for longer pet hair owners
reviewDescription: I wanted to love this vacuum and initially I did.  I discarded the packaging and mounted the charging base on wall.  I overlooked the first time,  the awkward process needed to empty the rather small debris cup and the fact that to completely empty this waste bin required digging out around the prefilter with my fingers.  The first time the brush roller attachment plugged, I blamed it on someone else for not emptying the cup when it was full.  After having this happen repeatedly,  I decided enough and am trying to return.  Longer pet hair defeats this vacuum and negates it's purpose in our home.

The vacuum works great for sand, but anything larger and it has a hard time. There's a flap where the vacuumed up stuff goes and I find that spot getting clogged or something stuck onto it every time i vacuum. Today I tried to vacuum popcorn up and it was a disaster, completely unable to vacuum popcorn. Or anything bigger than a grain of rice.. I think the battery is alright it goes down to 2 bars after 7 ish minutes.. it would be awesome if it charged wile hanging vs having to take the battery off everytime.

So, let me start off by saying that under no circumstances does this vacuum work on any type of carpet; no rugs, low pile, nothing. I read the reviews before I purchased and was under the impression this would work on carpets but it definitely does not. However, it works lovely on hardwood flooring; there is no rolling brush so it will suck up all pet hair and large debris with no problem. The only other thing I don’t like is that the cord is so small, this really is almost like a child’s vacuum.

Well, they call it featherweight for a reason. This is EXTREMELY lightweight. I am not sure it will last long because of that. It picks up dirt pretty well, but I am concerned about its lack of quality, and the light weight is actually an issue sometimes. For instance, when I tried to vacuum along the baseboard under my bed, it just didn't seem to hug the wall because it's so lightweight. All of the effort of making it stay along the base molding was coming from my arms instead of the vacuum itself.

The vacuum is very lightweight so that is a big plus for me with back pain issues. I got this to use on hardwood-like floors and I have a dog that sheds but not a lot. As soon as I got it out of the box and stood it up and went to plug it in, it fell over. It's not very sturdy. It doesn't have as much suction power as similar stick vacs I've had before in this price range so that is a little disappointing as well. It is quieter than ones I've had before. For a plug in vac rather than a cordless one I really was expecting more suction. My cordless one works much better. I have to go over the area of the floor several times for it to pick everything up. It is very easy to clean the bin out and the filter seems pretty standard. I do love the color of the vac. Overall I probably would not buy this again.

While the vacuum provides sufficient suction to pick up my Labrador's fur, the batteries don't last more than 20 to 25 minutes. There are 3 speed/power settings for the motor and for my cleaning needs I use the most powerful setting. I ended up purchasing a second battery to stretch my runtime but still run about 15 minutes short. Other than that it is easy to use and clean. The storage system also works well to keep the unit and two attachments out of the way.

reviewTitle: battery needs to be charged after 10 minutes
reviewDescription: does not hold a charge for very long and the silver lint cartridge gets clogged very easily… I had to buy more HEPA filters because they get so dirty. The reason I give it three stars is because the suction is good even though it only last 10 minutes before I have to clean it.its a little confusing to use..my 70 yr old Mom has a hard time with it and wants to use my cordless shark instead.

reviewTitle: Nice vac but battery capacity too small
reviewDescription: We bought this sweeper to do touch ups when grass bits and mulch bits get dragged into the house. So far, we have only used it on hardwood floors and throw rugs. It does a pretty good job, so we are happy with that. Its shortcoming is that the battery doesn't last long enough on its default mid-range power setting to finish sweeping the kitchen, dining room and foyer areas. We try to keep it on the low setting to conserve battery but every time it is turned off then back on it is on the middle setting. As I said, this sweeper is fine for what we need but is far too limited if someone expects to do any serious cleaning with it. We ordered a second battery that should help, it will be here in a couple of days.

Update: Stick is not clogged.  It doesn't perform well. When I try to use the high setting it runs for a few seconds than shuts off with the indicator lights flashing. Would not suggest buying. Apparently Bissell doesn't care, they have not reached out. I recently had an outsatanding experience with another manufacturer that responded to my review. That says alot about a company.I had high hopes for this vaccum. If my wife is not happy then I am not happy. Started out fine but now the vaccum is not picking up.  I changed the filter which is a bad idea for it to have this. Anyway it works great as a hand held vaccum cleaning desk, around TV. The stick probably is clogged, not sure. I have not looked at it yet.

reviewTitle: Great Suction for a small Vacuum
reviewDescription: For this being a small vacuum it worked great for my needs.  The filter area is small and has to be cleaned frequently as expected,  but works great.  I have to keep my cat litter box in an awkward area so cat litter tends to be a problem. This works great picking it up even on carpet.
I love this little guy, I’m going to buy another one.. just know the cord is very very short!! I have 2 short extension cords on mine. I love that it’s small, light, and strong!!!

reviewTitle: Over all good product, but super short cord
reviewDescription: I bought this for my hard floors.  I often felt as though a broom or dust mop was just pushing dust, crumbs, and hair around.  I had no illusions that it would work well on carpet and it doesn't. Still need a regular vacuum for that.  I am happy with my purchase because now I feel as though dirt is sucked up in to the holding cup and can be emptied.  It is easy to use, light weight and does stand on its own, contrary to another review I read. Maybe the company made an update.  My only complaint is that it has a short cord which is inconvenient when cleaning a whole room.

reviewTitle: Met my new butler, Mr Bissell !
reviewDescription: Mr Bissell is versatile, lean but well-built, and highly-efficient. Knocked off one star on suction because he sometimes fails to suck up bigger particles from the deep ridge grooves of my doormat. Otherwise suction is excellent with both the floor head and cranny tool, judging by eye & the amount of stuff in the filter basket after use. Only major knock on the design is that there is no way to attach the cranny tool to the main frame when not in use. A velcro cable tie on the handle shaft works fine, but you'd like to see a built-in option on  such a well-designed tool.As to parts & accessories, the filter is easy to access & clean, the cable plug has a notch to secure it to the more-than-long enough-for-my-tiny-space & well-insulated cable when coiled. The clips attaching the handle shaft and hand-vac section seem durable, secure, but easy to use. Floor head & cranny tool likewise easy to attach but fit snugly. Also love that the floor head swivels fully flat so Mr Bissell  & his sleek profile can mambo  under the bed without issue. A little rubber bumper  around the roller head might have been a nice touch to prevent dings against furniture, though. I put a couple of adhesive felt pads around the vertical edge to bumper crashes if I get clumsy. Worth noting that the floor head has low-slung wheels outside & two tiny recessed wheels under the front edge  but no rotating brush underneath, just a rubber strip,like the edging on a good dustpan, to scoop detritus to Mr Bissell's ...ummm...suckhole  & off  whatever surface it rolls/slides over. Probably why it works so well on bare floors, but it might not deep clean carpet as well as a  more traditional brush roller tool. I don't have pets so actually glad not to have to deal with hair/fibers matting a roller brush that wreck  cleaning ability if you don't detangle  the stringy crud regularly. Remains to be seen how durable that strip will be , of course. I only have lino tiles to protect so I can't really speak to scratching wood floors, but no obvious sharp edges on the undercarriage that might damage delicate flooring.I don't have stairs to clean but I do have a wire shelf unit in my kitchenette with a fridge/microwave on it, ie don't want to move it for light cleaning, & Mr Bissell's chiselled scnozz fits nicely through the wire mesh & sucks up the odd crumb very well. Ditto for the usual nooks/crannies.The slim lightweight form factor add to ease of use and storage in my small living space.A great addition to the household , all in all. Never needs a day off, discreet & honest,, no gallivanting with the other staff, although I suspect he has an affinity for Mr Swiffer WetJet who is also purple. But what's life without a little downstairs romantic intrigue ? Naranja & Azul my mismatched dustpan and brush (orange & blue in Spanish) are certainly thrilled with Mr B's arrival, spooning most of their time away in the closet,  idle little scamps, not to mention my creaky spine/knees.Oh dear, the trauma of moving apartments may have affected more than my back....
It is not very strong but is very lightweight. I only use it to pick up litter so it does the job.

I was a little disappointed in the stick vacuum as a whole. I know it's inexpensive but it it's almost like a child's toy vacuum. It does work as a "quick vac" but not efficient for large hardwood or tile floor area. As a handheld vacuum it works quite well and is great for stairs and cars or furniture. Good section as a handheld. Smaller dirt cup but ok if you're just doing small areas, or dump it out often no biggie. It is lightweight so great for anyone who can't handle a heavy vacuum.
Funciona bien..cumple c su objetivo..pero el cable es muy corto...es bastante ligera eso me gusta.
Works very well on floors and short carpet not the best on my long carpet
This lightweight vacuum is so awesome. I used it nonstop. The best purchase so far

This little featherweight stick vacuum has great suction… very easy to use and I love  that it has the attachments and the extension.  However, the directions say to clean the filter, “gently tap the filter against the wastebasket until all the debris is gone.”  Not happening.  To clear off the dirt film from the filter,  tapping will not do the job.  I used a dry toothbrush to lightly remove the dirt and dust that clung to the outside of the filter.  So far so good.  Not sure how long the fragile filter will last.  I suggest you take advantage of the 6 filter deal bundled with the vacuum because replacement filters from Bissell.com cost $4.99 each plus $6.99 shipping!  Just so you know…
Not good for carpet

Very disappointed in this vacuum.  Nowhere near 40 minute charge and rarely used on high setting.  Bissell replaced battery free of cost.  Canister extremely small and would become stopped up.  Trigger placement and power button  too close and would constantly be cutting off the vacuum.  Overall I would not recommend it.  Hopefully Bissell will refund my payment.  I’ve passed the return window at Amazon.
this looks like they took a cheap car vacuum and put a long handle on it. It is very light, but lacks much suction and is feels very flimsy. What did you expect for $24?

reviewTitle: Good Suction, Makes A Low Rumbling Noise Sometimes
reviewDescription: It is lightweight but does have good suction and pleased with that.  The problem is that once the filter becomes a little plugged, it emits a loud rumbling sound when using.  The problem I found is that the rubber flap that keeps the debris from falling back out in the dirt reservoir vibrates.  I called customer support and they are sending me a new filter, which I don't believe will help.  He said the other alternative is to send it back to Amazon.  I decided to keep it because I just use it for some indoor outdoor carpet in the garage and will clean the filter every time I use it.  I would not buy it again because of the vibration and noise.  I don't read many reviews that have this problem, but mine does.  I did read at least one other review that did have the exact same problem.

reviewTitle: Does not pick up well on carpets
reviewDescription: Nice weight but does not pick up dirt aw well as expected it too
Item came used with scratches. Disappointing.

reviewTitle: Left wondering if my unit is defective
reviewDescription: I bought this after hearing it works on carpet and it sort of does. If I use it as a hand vacuum, it works fine. Not great or anything but the actual vacuum with floor attachment barely picks up anything. I wouldn't mind since I bought it just for my personal room to clean with, but it's making this extremely loud noise when ever the vacuum is not at a 90 degree upright position leading me to believe it may be defective. I contacted support and will update this review. At time of writing I would recommend getting another vacuum.Edit: So I think figured out what the noise is. There is a piece of rubber that is supposed to hold the debris inside the vacuum but in my unit, it is being sucked and slapping against the plastic making a constant loud noise until I poke it and it resets into position. Still not a great vacuum unless you're only using it without the attachments.!

I have had this for over 2 years, but only used it about 5+ times. It doesn’t really suck up much dirt/ debris.I purchased it for my classroom, to tidy up any dirt dragged in from recess or tiny pieces of paper…and it does not really pick up much.

reviewTitle: Fully charged battery only last 15 minutes
reviewDescription: Love the lightness of the unit and the ease of use, but first use with a fully charged battery is only lasting 15 minutes. Will probably return.

Purchased this product to keep my office looking neat in between weekly vacuuming by the maintenance crew. I literally had one crumb and a small, not even 1/2-inch by 1/2-inch, patch of dirt someone dropped from their shoes. The dirt just got ground into the carpet because the Bissell never picked it up (actually picked it up with my lint roller, stuck well to the tape). I ended up picking up the crumb and throwing it in the trash. I even removed the filter again to ensure there was no packaging blocking the air flow. And, I have a very low pile carpet. I wish I could return it, but it's not defective and does not fall under any other return category. Usually, when I buy Amazon's Choice products, I am not lead wrong. There is always a first time...

Bought this product in April 2024, it went in the trash July, 2024.  I loved it.  It was perfect for our hardwood floors and tile.  Stored it in the garage with my other cleaning mops and brooms.  We had a very warm spell over several days and the cannister warped and would not stay together, it was useless.  I had not even given it a thought about being to hot for it in the garage storage cabinet.  So disappointed in its construction quality... as they say...you get what you pay for!

reviewTitle: We have 4 college degrees and could not put this together.
reviewDescription: Read the bad reviews! Sure it's quiet - it isn't doing much. The instruction book is missing a lot of information - like how to charge the battery (which weighs a ton) and why waste 2 pages on hanging up the vacuum holder on the wall when you don't tell me how to get it charged up and running. I am returning it with the three fleas it did suck up. I waited a week for this!!! BAH on Bissell. You should keep it simple silly.I am very disapointed and so are my cats.

Oddest little vacuum - no rollers, just an opening in the very middle of the underside. Now I understand why they throw in the handheld attachment for crevices/corners. Last time I bought a Bissell was not long before Covid began - still have it and it's much sturdier/heavier. This new one feels like lightweight cheap plastic. Yet I paid the same for both. Bissell is a good brand that I've used for over three decades now, but it's sad to see how low the quality has become :(

I have a black labrador, I purchased this mainly for his toy,bedroom and do a quick vacuum around the house.  I cannot vacuum the whole house without stopping and tempting the canister.  I have to do this twice.  By this time the battery is needing to be charged.

Not at all what I was expecting. I was looking for something compact and small for our rv. It definitely IS small and compact! But the suction.. well.. sucks. *and not in a good way* it hardly picks up small dried mud peices without spitting them back out. The attachments are great and versatile... but they will not work like you want them to. One the brighter side, it should be great without the extended wand to be used as a handheld for the truck. So all is not lost. If you are looking for something small that is powerful,  this is NOT that kind of vacuum.  But I'm sure I will still use it for the couch and truck seats... that kinda thing.🙂

reviewTitle: It sucks but not the debris on the carpet.
reviewDescription: I liked it the first three (3) times I used it because it did lift the dirt. The fourth (4th) time I used it and each time in a small area it just rolled  over everything without any suction. I will call the company and see what they say. I bought this crap the end of August 2023 but as I said I only used it four (4) times. The last time being a real disappointment as I was expecting company and had to use a broom with my arthritis which was painful. Honestly I would think some suction would be left after only four (4) short uses.

reviewTitle: Battery Life and Suction not good
reviewDescription: This vacuum has three speed modes but only works best in Turbo mode causing the battery life of 15-20 minutes rather than the 40 minutes it advertises. Suction is poor even in turbo mode. I would not recommend this product.
Only picks up 20% on flat carpet and 75% from hard floors - must sweep up leftovers as it leaves huge pile once finished vacuuming every time. Spend more money for something better or don’t bother.

reviewTitle: No brush, small dust collector, poor vacuuming
reviewDescription: I am honestly shocked at the number of great reviews for this thing.  This is a dust buster with a handle and removable wheels.  When I first put the wheels on the unit, I was surprised more than half the debris was still left on the ground.  I picked up the vacuum and looked under, no brush and a tiny suction hole extension (really? No brush in a vacuum? Is it a broom?)  It’s cheap but literally cheap  Get something that actually works
I got this vacuum to replace a Dirt Devil, this is so flimsy, it feels like it’s going to fall apart! It doesn’t do a great job either, DD was way better!

reviewTitle: Battery life is way too short & canister is much too small
reviewDescription: The battery doesn't hold a charge nearly long enough. I live in 1,400-square-foot house and I couldn't even finish vacuuming on one charge. Also, this is advertised as a 'pet' machine. The small canister has to be emptied twice (and I vacuum every other day!). I should have bought another Shark.
Nice cute small vacuum for my tiny area. My only complaint is it’s not very strong at all. They couldn’t even pick up a couple hairs off the ground.
Al principio funcionó lo más bien,la última vez que se utilizó funcionó normal .Se limpio y se guardo funcionando cuando se fue a utilizar hoy no prende .
Product was pretty scuffed up to be "like new" it's very low quality, which is understandable for the price. Only good for small messes if you ask me.

I returned this for two reasons — it kept making a clicking noise for no apparent reason and it doesn’t stand up by itself. It did seem to clean well (I used it twice for about five minute each) but just wasn’t right for me.

No matter what mode you use while vacuuming, as soon as the vacuum is turned off cat litter and other things similar in size just fall right back down into the wand and brush roll. Making this vacuum almost useless for some pet owners.

The floor peace broke after a month using it , doesnt suck well, if you put it on level 3 the battery dies quick, trying to get to customer service it's just not working or they say not available at this moment

reviewTitle: This vacuum sucks... actually it doesnt
reviewDescription: So tbh I bought this vacuum for my apartment because it's small and I didn't feel like needing a nicer one. But man it is terrible! So tiny and it has no roller so it really doesn't clean all that well. It works find for light messes here and there but it just isn't worth the extra hassle it would take to use it for everything.

reviewTitle: Cute but doesn't do the job
reviewDescription: living with a medical condition this vacuum was attractive to me because of its weight and reviews of how well it picks up.  A heavy vacuum can leave me out of breath by the time I'm done vacuuming and navigating stairs alone with ataxia made this attractive.  The fact that it is a Bissell came me some confidence.  I received this and found it easy to assemble and lightweight.  The first use I found it is ok on hardwoods and more a challenge on carpet.  After about 10 mins of vacuuming it started making a very loud noise as if it is being overused.  I checked the canister and found it wasn't clogged, just couldn't stand up to the wear of an average sized space.  Sadly I returned and will continue looking for a vacuum to meet my needs.

Easy to assemble. Lightweight. Feels more like a dustbuster on a stick. Not super strong suction. Will be good enough for my daughter to take to college for her room, though. I wouldn’t recommend for an entire house.

Love  not toting a cord around. Sometimes I have to remind myself that it's not there. Really good pick er up er. Just wish the battery lasted longer. Might want a back up. Bought one for my daughter who has a cat. We have shedding dog and it works for the in between hefty vacuum days.

Bought it for my travel trailer. And it was great for small vacuum!! Suction was great and attachment works good. Wasn't sure how good will be but, I read reviews and did was my choice. And yes, I will recommend it also! I have dog also and it work pretty good 👍  great value for money!

This cordless vacuum is great! I wanted an extra smaller vacuum to keep upstairs so I wouldn't have to keep carrying the bigger one up and down the steps. I was surprised at how well it picks up...especially hair from my 2 dogs.  I really didn't think it would work well on all the dog hair but it really does! It comes with more attachments than my corded vacuum! It's light and goes under furniture easily.  And, it's much quieter than my other vacuum. I would buy this again in a second.

reviewTitle: FLEAS! FLEAS! FLEAS! In Garage NOW GONE
reviewDescription: I have owned pets all my life.  Recently, one of my cats decided she didn't want to come inside and liked sleeping on my porch,  I set up a place for her by using her plastic carrier (top and bottom nested on top of each other so top was wide open to air with the carrier wire door slipped between the 2 plastic carrier pieces).  She slept on a thick folded beach towel and/or think large old towel which I washed/changed out once a week.  Then she decided not to sleep there any longer and I forgot about it for weeks before bringing the whole thing into the garage and put the dirty beach towel in the dirty clothes open basket next to the washer where fleas proceeded to breed over the next 3 weeks as I just did laundry and didn't go back into the garage.I didn't want to spread poisons from DIYpestcontrol in my garage and spreading salt and Diatomaceous dirt did not kill the fleas.  Fleas were literally jumping on my ankles/lower legs whenever I stood next to the washer.Vacuuming works but I did not want to use my house Dyson in the garage and possible spread those fleas into my house or ruin my vacuum cleaning a garage.My sister told me to buy Bissell stick cleaner 2773a (with a roller) (she uses one to clean her wood stairs)  because it would be cheaper and safer than buying all those bug sprays, bug bombs (from past experience they don't work) and it was not that expensive and I had nothing to lose by trying it.  I choose to buy this 2330 smaller blue Bissell because it it not have a roller and the fleas/eggs/larvae would not get stuck in the roller but be sucked directly up into the vacuum.  I put Vaseline on my bare legs from knees down (wearing shorts) (internet tip)  and went into the garage and closed the door between garage/house to keep pets out and fleas in.  I vacuumed like hell and dumped the vacuum container every 10 minutes into a bucket filled with water that I swept (with a garage broom) and dumped all that salt and dirt into that bucket.  I figured flea eggs, fleas, larvae would be killed instantly in that salt water.  The Vaseline killed any fleas that landed on my ankles/lower legs (GROSS). I exited the garage though the garage door and used the outdoor hose (I have hot water outside as well as cold - which I had put in years ago) and an old rag to wash the Vaseline and stuck dead fleas off.  I did this several times a day over 3 days and now no fleas jump on me anywhere in the garage.  I leave this blue vacuum plugged in in the garage right by the door and grab it as soon as I walk in and start vacuuming before I do laundry, before I take the wet laundry out and into the dryer and whenever I think about it because I am paranoid the fleas will come back.I leave this blue Bissell in my garage.  I purchased another Bissell 2773A (gray one with a roller/bit pricier) to keep next to the litter box.  These vacuums are so light, easy to put together and are very effective on on fleas and cat litter.  I am surprised I didn't burn this blue Bissell vacuum (without roller) out since I used it so much in the garage and still do.  Plus even though I used a broom to sweep up the salt crytals I dumped onto the garage floor to kill fleas (didn't work), this vacuum did not clog up or burn out picking up the salt / dirt my broom missed.  If my blue Bissell ever dies, I will buy another because I like having it in the garage as my garage has never been so clean.

I wasn’t sure if this vacuum would work because I have fluffy soft rugs but to say I was surprised is an understatement! You can’t beat the price either and it’s so compact so I can fit easily in my laundry closet to put it away. Definitely would recommend if you’re just looking for something basic!

reviewTitle: This was able to get all of the fur off of our floor bed!
reviewDescription: I have an elderly puppy at home. She struggles with going up and down the stairs now, and getting on and off the couch without help.So I purchased a floor bed for us to sleep on, positioned under her favorite couch. No more stairs for bedtime. She can jump on her favorite couch, and stick the landing again because of our bed. Problem is, I have to leave the bed out. If I fold it up she will wipeout attempting to get on and off the couch.Needless to say this bed has gotten a bit dirty and covered in fur. I have a few handheld vacuums that are less than helpful for getting the fur off of this bed.This vacuum did. This vacuum has our bed looking fresh out of the box.I am so grateful.Thank you Bissell for making a product that ensures my elderly pup has a clean place to sleep on, a clean landing spot, and a clean launchpad.

I don't generally gush about my Amazon buys.  I average an order a day and I have been doing it for over 20 years.  This little guy is just a jewel.  Pops together in two mins out of the box.  Light and easy to use.  Quiet, even.  Not the strongest suction but adequate and gets the job done.  Amazing.  I would like slightly larger dirt cup but this is fine.  Yes, a longer cord would be better, but ... extension cords are cheap.  One thing I would add that would cost nothing:  A clip where the crevice tool can be carried onboard when not in use.  But that is a very minor detail.  Five stars for this little appliance which now gets used almost daily.  Congrats Bissel, job well done.

I like this product. My first one lasted for years. It really does clean snd remove dust. The one problem is the attachment piece for crevices is very hard to change from the main piece. It is hard to remove it to change back to the original part. Can be made easier in the future.

I love my little stick vac! With hard floors and 3 cats that shed, I was tired of sweeping every day. This little vacuum is so easy to use that it doesn't feel like a chore to do my floors.I almost bought a cordless, but saw a review saying this one was really good with pet hair, so I ordered this corded vacuum instead. I have no regrets. The time I spend moving the cord is much less than I spent going back over areas I had already swept, and I don't have to chase down stray cat hairs.No loss of suction. Small enough to keep in the pantry. Very light. Quiet!

This lightweight vacuum was exactly what I was looking for.  I have a big, heavy vacuum for the deep cleaning but this little vacuum is perfect for those in-between time.  It's great for picking up my dog's hair that seems to be everywhere.  I also really like that it can be taken apart to be a quick and convenient hand-held dust buster.
It works but it’s not that powerful basic stuff it’s great

I am a long time Bissel fan and I own many of these vacuums. This particular model has a fatal flaw though. If you ore holding it in your and it blows air directly in your face which is very irritating. The engineers need to relocate the fans.
Smaller than I thought, but it gets the work done

The vacuum itself is awesome. It picks up really well, comes with a ton of parts but the battery is absolutely terrible. On the high setting it barely makes it 10-15 min. Before it dies. Then I have to wait another 3-4 hours for it to fully charge.
I'm not sure if this vaccum even does anything

I always empty the dust holding area AND clean the filter AND clean the roller but still, even on simple things, suction is not at all what I hoped for.  Do appreciate the  lightweight feature…cannot locate the crevice tool.

I wanted to love this but first of all, where you hold the vacuum is the same place the power button is, so it is constantly turning off while using. The charge was horrible and probably defective. I had to return it. It did have great suction but it could only be used for a very few minutes.  I would repurchase just for the suction power despite the very strange place for the power button, but I don’t know if power tome would be better. Drawback of having to remove battery to charge it was a big negative for me. I think if you have a place to install the hardware you may not have to remove battery, but I am not 100% sure about that.
Filter works well, for its size.
It was great I loved the light and a few months I. It just spits out the dirt and leaves it behind and I’ve tried everything to fix it. I’m really disappointed
Very easy to put together and work but unfortunately it stop sucking as hard after a couple months even after cleaning out and taking apart but it’s cute easy to store
Es buena medida pero pecimo material el arroz se pega en el fondo y eso no está bien

reviewTitle: Does not work on the thinnest rug
reviewDescription: Good vacuum for hardwood but does not work on any of my rugs, even the thinnest one.

This reminds me of the toy vacuum cleaners we had as kids.  It really is more like a toy or something you'd use in an RV.  It's very lightweight, which I like, but it's just a handvac with a handle.  Surprisingly, it picks up well but it definitely doesn't have the power of a regular vacuum.

reviewTitle: Can’t charge without removing the battery
reviewDescription: Vacuum works great, but inconvenient to have to remove the battery every time I charge it.
Good for a small office space. Nice and light, but not very good suction.

So when I started searching for a cordless vacuum these are the features I was looking for and thought I had found the prefect one with Bissell.First off, it does not stand on its own.The battery does not seem to last long if running on high. I have mostly hard flooring with the exception of area rugs, it does get in and under some small places, a bit top heavy but that was expected. I havnt put it to full use yet with the attachments and all as I've only had it a couple days. Hope this helps someone.

Just received this vacuum for my RV camper. Used it for a bit and it seemed to heat up quickly but still did the job. I would’ve given it 4 stars if it wasn’t missing the top hook for the electrical wire.
Convenient to use but not very powerful. Battery charges quickly.

reviewTitle: Does the job but not amazing
reviewDescription: Bought this to use in our camper for a very small area. I feel the handheld part does better than the full vacuum. The cord is long and the suction is ok. Would not recommend this for a large home.
Battery does not last very long

Love love love it!!!!!!Amazing how light it is and powerful. I use it on my bare kitchen floor and bathroom floor. So much easier than dragging out the vacuum cleaner. Highly recommend. Look forward to use it to clean car. Took me less than 5 minutes to put together. Great quality for the price.

reviewTitle: Great value!  Perfect for wood floors!
reviewDescription: I first bought a Bissel Featherweight many, many years ago for $15 at Wal Mart and used that same vacuum for 7 years.  Eventually, I thought I should get a big girl vacuum.  Since then I’ve owned Sharks and Roombas.  I am back to the Bissel Featherweight!  It’s light and perfect for wood/ tile floors.  The Roombas, though very convenient, both died just after the warranties expired (wth!), the Shark sucked about the same as this thing (maybe less), sounded like a lawnmower, and cost $200ish.
