For the price, I am honestly not sure there’s anything better than this little vacuum.  Maybe one day, when I have several hundred dollars to spend, I’ll try a Dyson or something.  But this inexpensive little thing has trumped everything else I’ve spent hundreds of dollars on!

My vacuum arrived yesterday, I put it together and immediately vacuumed my hall rugs...WOW! for such a small vacuum, it worked VERY well. I have hardwood floors throughout my house, and area rugs and runners for my dog.This vacuum actually pick up the dog hair from my dark colored rugs!!! I am delighted!!!

I've already had Dissell 1240, which accompanied with me for 8 plus years. Recently, it started making a chainsaw like noise after a heavy duty job. I ended up replacing with a new brush roller. It worked great again. The reason I got this 3-in-1 is because I wanted to get it for the stairs and my car. Overnight shipping was fantastic. First thing in the morning at 6 am, 3-on-1 was on my porch. I was very exctied to find out how it turned out. After the first try, I felt like it was better than I expected. I used to be struggling with vacuuming the stairs for years. This 3-in-1 made this job so easy. Furthermore, it does a great job for my sectional, sitting area, underneath my piano, and other small areas. By using it on my car is just lovely. It swept every corner. I felt so good with driving and sitting on my fresh and dustless car. Another thing I would like to mention is that I was amazed by the suction based on this type of small model. Please don't take me wrong. You don't expect this works as power as the big power vacuum cleaner. That is why I have two vacuums at home. However, if you live in a smaller space such as a studio or dorm, it should work fine.The downside of this item is that it doesn't pick up hair efficiently. I had to move back and forth until the hair was picked up. So, I brushed off the hair by using a toothbrush before vacuume the rest of the stairs. I wish it comes with a part with a brush. That way, I can a better job on picking up hair and not making scratches on the surfaces other than furniture.I am very happy with my purchase. I may give another review after one year. I hope I would leave another positive review by then. Lastly, I hope this 3-in-1 lasts as long as my Bissell 1240 does.

I thought I'd ordered cordless and almost returned it, but happy I didn't. Saved money and this little thing works great. Also as a Dustbuster. Keeping it simple. I have enough plugs in my small house to make this work. Great on vinyl and wood. Picks up bigger pieces than I would have thought.
This stick vacuum is fabulous, I cleaned the inside of my vehicle first & it did a wonderful job. Then I decided to try on carpet & tile! Great vacuum for the money

This great little stick vac is EXACTLY what I was looking for, and it even comes in my favorite color!Also, huge shout-out to reviewer Wizzette for the tip about attaching a velcro strip -- I was blown away by how much more hair and dirt was picked up with this simple addition! My husband and I both have very long hair, plus we have three cats and a dog, so our rugs attract a LOT of hair/fur. You'll have to pause to clean out the velcro strip kind of frequently (in my experience at least) but that hack took this already great vacuum to a whole new level!

reviewTitle: This great little vacuum cleaner does the job!
reviewDescription: Purchased this Bissell Featherweight vacuum cleaner for our RV. Positive reviews convinced me to buy and I am so glad I did. WOW!!! This vacuum cleaner works well and its small size and versatile design is perfect for our needs. I tried it in our house and it’s strong and SO easy to use. The cord is plenty long enough and it’s small size will make it very easy to store in a corner. My almost 5 yo granddaughter looks forward to helping grandma vacuum on an upcoming camping trip!  At $30 it’s an unbelievable deal! This vacuum cleaner is clearly designed for smaller places so don’t let those negative reviews affect your decision to buy if you are seeking an effective vacuum solution for smaller spaces.

I am really pleased with the job the Bissell CleanView XR Pet cordless vacuum does. It picks up every including dog hair without having to go over the area repeatedly. The attachments do an excellent job of removing pet hair on everything from furniture to carpeted stairs. It has exceeded my expectations.

People suck at making reviews so I am here to give this a go! I took a chance here buying this vacuum because the one I had was old, annoying, loud, stank 🗣️, and was overall hard to put away. This one is GREAT. It’s not to loud, it’s extremely light, thin so it’s easy storage and the suction is great! My old one was not picking up the carpet power for cleaning so I was quite literally walking in sand…although small, this one has great suction! I gave it a go with the powder and it SUCK IT ALL UP 🫄 The bottom (as seen in the photo), does not have a brush comb as seen in other vacuums but the suctions is really good and picked up hair and dust. It does not need to be charged, it has a plug that’s pretty long so it’s goes around my room good enough. Easy to clean, only an Off/On button and to take it apart is simple. You can take off the pole and just hold it, and take off the bottom part suction to make it a mini vacuum for bed crumbs or couches ect. For $33~ bucks I’m extremely happy :) I good simple vacuum for good simple use. Thank you for listening to my Ted talks 💋

Cleans great so far.  Battery is enough to clean entire main floor and them some.  Attachments work well too.  My only complaint, the wall mount storage caddy is huge.  Sticks out from the wall over a foot.  Finding a place with an outlet that doesnt obstruct doorways, washer dryer opening, etc.,  was a challenge.  Ended up in the basement since closets don't have outlets and it is an eyesore anywhere else.

Putting this together it felt SUPER flimsy and I thought there’s no way this is going to work. Surprisingly it worked pretty well! I just use it for hard floors and a small office area. It’s not something I’d use for my whole house by any means.

I bought one for my office, since maintenance no longer uses a real vacuum to clean floors everyday. They use those ghostbuster vac packs. I was tired of finding debri. This does the job and good value. Wish it had a roller to do a better job.

It seems flimsy, but it is a hard worker! East to use, light, good suction. A good buy. I bought it to replace my big, heavy, clumsy vac that I would haul upstairs for the second floor, but I’m using it instead of the big one everywhere.

Easy to change parts for certain jobs.  I wish it had a bit more power, but it gets the job done.  It would have been better if they had a soft cushion around the edges to make sure the part doesn't scratch floors.

reviewTitle: Definitely for smaller jobs like a dorm room.
reviewDescription: this for my son's dorm room. It's definitely meant for smaller areas but it seemed to work well when I tested it.  This one was returned at some point as you can tell the box was open  at someone and stuff were not put in really well. But the important part is it worked in the small area I tested.

I love the vacuum! The suctioning power is great and it doesn't have one of this little brushes at the end that spin that eventually get sick with hair and cause issues. Unfortunately though, I will be returning because the extension cord is way too short and 100% requires elan extension cord or something which I don't feel like dealing with. Don't know what Bissell was thinking with this cord length lol.

reviewTitle: Why is it that the bald guy.....
reviewDescription: .....has to suck up all the 'girl hair' in the house?!?  I think my girls just shed out of spite.  Alas, I'm armed with a handy little weapon.... I'll get you my pretties!!!!Wish the battery would last a little longer..... The unit is well built. At first, it was so quiet that I questioned it's effectiveness. It was a little deceiving as it really captures a lot of debris for a rather quiet device.

The cleaner doesn’t have much power, but that’s what I expected.However it does an ok job for which I bought it.I am able to clean the runner by my front door with it.It’s light weight and easy to use.

Easy to use and effective. Appreciate the versatility of the hand vacuum with the attachment tube. That did a great job cleaning our cars and couches. I’m glad it has a cord so we don’t have to worry about a battery dying. We’ve only had it for two months so giving 4/5 for now.
We have three dogs and this is so handy and keeps up with the dog hair. I wish it would have come with 2 batteries because the battery does die pretty quickly but it picks up ALL the dog hair.

This vacuum is perfect for hardwood/ laminate flooring and our 1 area rug! It does great for not having a beater bar!The cord is VERY short. We have to move to different plug ins to vacuum our living room.

reviewTitle: Works great on hardwood and amall carpets!
reviewDescription: I have mainly hardwood floors in my house with a few little throw carpets. This little vacuum works great on the hard wood and gets the little carpets clean I am very impressed! Its very lightweight. If I had one complaint it would just be that the cord is a little too short.

We recently built a house with LVP flooring. I read many article able what type of vacuum cleaners to use so decided on this one. Am surprised at how well it cleans. Only complaint is that the filter catches all the dirt and none does into the canister. I know it means the filter is doing its job but makes having to constantly stop and clean it.

Good little sweeper for hard floors! Super lightweight. Easy to use. Decent suction. Picked up a lot of dirt in just a few minutes. Wouldn't do well on carpet. Would lift maybe surface dirt, but I already have a sweeper for that. If you're looking for something for quick daily clean up that won't wear you out, this is it. My 5 yr old can even use it. It does have a short cord but that wasn't a deal breaker. Love the crevice tool.

This little guy does the job but definitely only for small pick ups, but great for what it does. We bought our daughter one for her new house and she loves it and uses it constantly as it picks up great after her sons crumbs. Definitely recommend and great little picker upper.
Good on hardwood and area rugs. Not sure how well it would do on a lot of carpet. Works well for me just know its limitations. The dust compartment does need emptying often. It is pretty small.
This light weight pet vacuum does work. it picks up my cat hair but she is not a heavy shedder. I wish the battery lasted longer. It easy to clean with the push button to dump the debris.

I used it a few days after receiving it.  Couldn't believe how light it is.  Is great for floors, but not carpeting.  The reason being that this vacuum doesn't have a roller brush, but a squeegee type floor contact.  Very difficult for me on carpeting due to my age. However, it does have great suction.  Delivery was on time.

reviewTitle: Everything I was wanting - except the cord is short. Still happy with my purchase.
reviewDescription: I wanted a lightweight sweeper for hard floors, and this meets those requirements. (This is the only thing I use this sweeper for.) It has good suction. The dust cup is easy to empty. I saw another review about using a coffee filter over the filter in the dust cup, and I love this idea! It keeps the cloth-like filter clean, and still the suction seems great. The biggest negative thing I can say is the cord is short, and I have to move it to different outlets frequently.
It doesn't suction well. I have to cover an area several times and not good with the dog hair

reviewTitle: Selective on what it picks up
reviewDescription: Definitely not heavy duty as it doesn't pick up as much as it should. The suction is very light. It doesn't scare my pets though 😅There's always still dirt, pet fur,  left over.However it is light weight and easy to clean. It is nice that you are able to convert it to a hand held plug in. Even then it didn't pick up the normal debris in the car.I will be buying a better vacuum as this one just doesn't really do much.
This product doesn’t work as claimed.It doesn’t get hair off the carpet & barley gets dirt off the carpet.You’re better off saving to buy a more powerful vacuum cleaner.

reviewTitle: cheap and for very small room - does not vacuum properly
reviewDescription: i wanted a cheap small vacuum for my small room. this does not vacuum a piece of hair or dust until you actual align it on the exact middle. will keep it just for the price and for small items i need to vacuum. this just blow s the area? not really a vacuum. if you need a proper vacuum or very strict to cleaning, DO NOT BUY THIS. if you want to buy strict budget, usual clean small room and just want an alternative to sweeping and wiping, can consider this
Honestly this thing barely sucks anything up. It’s a cute color though, lol.

reviewTitle: suck isn't great, side exhaust blows onto the dust, loud
reviewDescription: sucking power automatically makes this not worth the money, you'd be much better off with a 12-amp 50 dollar one. if your cat kicked a couple sparse bits of sand as he finished his business, this vacuum will have a very hard time picking those up, and it won't pick them up all the way.the wide hose extension (with the wheels on it) likes to 'collect' a lot of dust/etc and not actually let it get sucked into the dust compartment, so if you suck some stuff up, turn it off and set it down, stuff falls out. this isn't a fault of the rubber trap, just the sucking power. it's also pretty loud for how weak it is. in the end i have an easier time with a household broom, and use the vacuum to get the dust pile from that.the 2 side exhausts will blow directly onto the dust if you're in tight quarters, eg. stairs or going horizontally under a low table.you'll wanna make sure you empty it somewhere outdoors, since you'll have to scrape/peel off the dust from the net and it plumes when you do that.the only good thing is that when it does work as i'd hoped (coincidentally), it's really easy on my bad shoulder. it's also pretty decent on very, very, very short rugs for a quick clean up. if you JUST need something to be able to suck up a big powder spill and you don't have an extra 20 dollars, this might be for you.

reviewTitle: doesn't work well, battery doesn't last more then 10 mins. doesn't fit under furniture well at all
reviewDescription: the battery doesn't last more then 10 mins.  it doesn't go under furniture well at all.  very disappointed in it.

I bought this almost 3 years ago for my 2 bedroom apt, I honestly don’t like it.. wether is use it on my vinyl floors in kitchen/bathroom or on my carpet it just doesn’t seem to have the best suction. I can always still feel salt/dirt immediately after vacuuming (vacuuming over same spot multiple times) and regular fuzz/hair is just doesn’t not do it for me. I also tend to throw it around while vacuuming due to how light it is! I’m not sure if I’m just using it wrong or what.. I clean it out after every use and it doesn’t seem to pick up much
Couldn't vacuum up cat litter, just pushed it around, even on Turbo mode. Sending back.

reviewTitle: Filters get clogged after limited use
reviewDescription: The suction power with a new disposable filter picks up dust off of rug. But after limited use the suction power is reduced to almost nothing because the filter gets clogged. Although the replaceable filter can be cleaned, the suction power after a cleaning is noticeable reduced. We purchased extra filters but the extra time spent changing and cleaning the filters is burdensome.

This will clean floors and pick up debris in corners, but does NOT clean carpets. If you have any sort of carpet or rug, this is not the vac for you. I have a cat and have allergies to dust, and I thought I would save money with this little vac. Well I was wrong and had to buy another vac that actually sucked dirt and hair out of carpet.

I just missed the return window. I tried it out , however really doesn't work .It's great for the use of a broom but not at all for any type of carpet.Kept forgetting to return it .Until I just tired to use it now to vacuum my area rug and remembered it doesn't work on the rub. So guess who's using a broom.

reviewTitle: The motor was sparking with a horrid stench on day one.
reviewDescription: I got 2 of these for my boys for Christmas. The suction wasn’t absolutely amazing, but for a cheap vacuum, it did the job for my sons just to clean up as they wanted.Not even after 5-10 minutes the motor starts sparking. And not a little sparks it stunk, and I had to navigate a 2 year old tantrum while I pulled the other one out.I then got the other one together and ready, and it was sparking (without the horrid scent) after about 2 minutes.I’m not risking my 1 and 2 year old sons getting injured with a faulty motor.That was 2 for 2.I was so excited about these vacuums for Christmas, but it turned into such a fiasco with my screaming toddlers wanting to vacuum.I’ll be asking for a refund.
Bought for RV but not enough suction for carpeted areas. Works well for light pick up and bare floors though.

This on the highest setting only lasts about 10 to 15 minutes! But hey if you have a tiny house or don't mind spending $69.95 for a second battery, oh and I stopped looking after that but you'll need a charger as well! Don't buy this!!

So I bought this thinking that it’s gonna be good for just quick pick ups in my room instead of going up and down the stairs all the time, but it literally does not pick up anything when you put the bottom part roller on it, and it just has no suction And even when you take the roller bottom off, it will only pick up like the big things in a couple small things! I’m going to have to order something different because I give this two stars ! And I’m returning it
It is very lightweight convenient for hardwood floors, this sweeper doesn't work on carpet well at all.

I was unimpressed with this. It's fine as a handheld vacuum for little areas but it did not work for what I needed it for - which was just a rug. I was in a studio apartment at the time and only needed a vacuum for a rug that was in my apartment. It just didn't suction well so I never felt like I could get it clean. I wouldn't recommend unless you're just wanting it to clean up crumbs and stuff on a hard surface - definitely not a carpet or rug vacuum.

Expected more from this vacuum.  When on setting 3 (the highest suction) it works great!  But it lasts 7 minutes at best at that level.  So I find myself keeping it on a level 2 to get at least 20 minutes to do my wood floors.  Very disappointed

reviewTitle: Buyer beware, the item I received was used
reviewDescription: I hate to leave a poor review when the only issue is the service, hence my 2 stars. Those 2 stars are for the fairly decent ability for this flimsy little stick vac to suck up random crumbs on a hardwood floor and a low pile carpet. Unfortunately when I opened the box, the filter inside the vacuum was used, covered in the dust and lint of someone else's home:(  I contacted Amazon even though it was past the return window (understanding I could not return) to see if they would be upstanding in offering me a credit to replace the used filter. No such luck. Kind of surprised and disappointed at this poor customer service. I would recommend buying this product elsewhere and be careful with these 3rd party sellers. Selling used items as new is not ok.

reviewTitle: Its a starter vacuum for kids really
reviewDescription: You really can you this vacuum for kids who want to vacuum their own room it not too good for bigger carpet areas but if you have a smaller space like a kids room or guest room this is really it. Otherwise it not longevity and doesn't hold that much dirt .
I’ve had this vacuum just over a month and it has clogged after almost every use. Now, the battery is completely dead, it has been charged all night and won’t turn on. Avoid this vacuum!!

I orders this because I wanted something to vacuum my basement and my enclosed porch areas so I didn’t track so many outside things through my living spaces. Emptying the dust cup was a pain and it just got dust everywhere. The suction is also not that great, and I noticed the things that I vacuumed coming out of the vacuum when I lifted it up and while on my way to empty the cup. I ended up ordering a canister vacuum.

I gave this 2 stars because it is lightweight as claimed and has good pick up from hatd floors. Epic fail on carpet and dust tends to escape from dirt cup after only a small amount of debris. For the price, I kept it as an electric broom.

I purchased this product after reading all the great reviews.  This is not a great vacuum.  I was surprised at how weak the suction was.  It couldn't even pick up a dry leaf on my hardwood floor!  There are no rollers or anything to help pick up debris.  It's just weak suction.  The other issue is that the cord is way too short.  If you have a medium to large kitchen you will need to plug it into multiple outlets.  I gave this product a fair chance but it is clearly not what it is cracked up to be.  I thought I should write the review for others to be forewarned.
I bought this for my thin rugs and it worked great for like 3 days and then now the suction is non existent. Not worth it
Battery life is awful, and now everytime I try to charge it all I get is the red light. Only had one month. DO NOT BUY
Barely picks anything up from my carpet or hardwood floor.

reviewTitle: Battery does not last enough to clean my whole house.
reviewDescription: Battery does not last enough to clean my whole house.
Unusable on rugs.  Fine on laminate type floors.

Its just the right size. It was easy to assemble. Most important it does the job. Great suction for vacuuming spaces. Can also be used by hand for furniture. Just what was needed for this jazzy senior.

Love this lil vacuum. I bought it specifically for our camper/RV. Will work like a charm and easy to place on the wall when done. As a test I ran through the whole house with a 65# Australian shepherd/husky mix and all that hair I have not picked up in a week. Did a great job. Plus took the stairs on as a champ. Looking to purchase a bigger model for the house. Downfall if you have a big house this is not for you. The cord is not lengthy and the  I had to change the container a few times. Otherwise it's a great product.

We use this little gem practically on a daily basis to keep up with pet hair on hard surface floors.As for power, I actually prefer a corded vacuum .  Rechargeable is great, until you need it right away and then discover that you forgot to charge it.  The cord is nice and long, but not-at-all bulky, and you get reliable and powerful suction with every use.It's easy to carry from room to room, maneuvers well, has great suction, easy to empty, and takes up very little space in the broom closet.I highly recommend.

I purchased this as a gift for my daughter, after using a similar one for over a year in a small carpeted apartment. It is very light and the suction works well as long as it is emptied frequently. It is a 2-in-one tool, and is easily converted to a hand-held vac. It is worth adding a length to the cord with a lightweight extension cord if your outlet access is limited.

The only thing I don't like is the cords short I just stuck an extension cord on it so that works. Otherwise it does suck up stuff on my laminate floors pretty good. It's like a long dust buster. I take it outside to empty it in the garbage can because it's exactly like a dustbuster,Dust debri tends to fly around.
It’s great, not perfect but works for what I need! It is a small compact vaccum. Easy to use and move around. I use it for a rug in my apartment and on hard wood floors.

reviewTitle: For use in my travel trailer
reviewDescription: This is a great little compact vacuum that works really good in my travel trailer. It’s so small and easy to take apart so storage of it is super easy. I appreciate it durable and strength.

Love the color.  It is VERY light.  It works well on both hard floors and carpet.  The cord is fairly long.  It quickly turns into a hand-vac by removing the long handle.  It would be nice to have a place to store the crevice tool but, given the price, can't ask for any more!  This is the 2nd one I have purchased (one was a gift).

I'm using an old adage, "The Proofs in the Pudding," to express my praise of this little vacuum. When no lint remains on my black rugs after using this little vaccum, I have to say, "The Proofs in the Black Rugs." Removing lint from black rugs is a bear and this little vacuum does it for me.I'm spending some of my retirement years in little camper trailer. I have lived in large homes and had high-end power vacs, but don't have room for a power vac in my trailer so bought this little thing. I am very impressed. I read a few reviews that faulted this little vac on having adequate suction. I have not found that a problem for me. This little vac has an amazing amount of suction. I just vacuumed these rugs and wanted to show you the pictures. They look lovely.I will share that the leopard spotted rug has a tighter nap than the completely black rug, so I did buy a little hand-held rug brush to pick up some of the lint the first few times I vacuumed. However, the brush seems to have lifted the nap in such a way that now the vacuum picks up the lint on its own quite nicely. (I did not use the brush today and as you can see the rug looks very nice.) If you have a tighter nap you might try a hand-held rug brush in combination with this little vacuum.If you have no room for a power vacuum, or want a light, little vacuum for quick jobs, I would highly recommend this one.

Fantastic lightweight, versatile, easy to use little vac. The way the accessories securely lock into place on the stick for transport and to the canister/motor when in use and then release with the simple pushbutton when you want to change them is brilliant.  The smaller roller head that swivels is perfect for steps. I'm thrilled with this vacuum!
Very good for its priceI just didn’t like that the cord isn’t that long

reviewTitle: It's all easy to put together.
reviewDescription: Does a good job of cleaning? But the battery life could be a little longer.

I like it because it does not have to be charged; I added an extension cord to it. It's basically a broom. It's not going to vacuum carpets or such. But, I love it for running around the house cleaning up dust, hair, and whatnot. I bought one for my vacation house, too. I like this item.

reviewTitle: Nice! But not perfect for my rugs
reviewDescription: I bought it for my rugs but it didn’t work out like I wanted.

reviewTitle: Pretty good but lacks a bit
reviewDescription: Overall for the price paid I was happy with it. It didn’t work on carpet much at all for us but most of the house has hard floors so it works for us. My daughter claimed it as her vacuum and that made her excited to use it. So I got that going for me. Which is nice.

For the price, I cannot complain. This is lightweight and works ok. I wish it had a little more suction power for stubborn animal hair but otherwise, works good. Comes with an attachment for small place. I wish there was a place to store the attachments because i do not want to misplace these. If there is a storage spot on the vacuum, please let me know, I did not notice one. Overall, not bad for the price.

reviewTitle: So light weight and pretty good suction, BUT....
reviewDescription: Yes, this is featherweight, and I love that feature, and being the plug in variety is probably what gives it such good suction, BUT...the cord is too short. You have to keep plugging it into a different plug constantly if you plan to do the whole house. I have a small 1200 sq foot home, I would think that replugging twice would be plenty, but every time I move to another area, I have to unplug and find another receptacle to plug it into, it's aggravating. Maybe it's just me, but I bought it for the lightweight feature because I am older and have difficulty with the full sized vacuum...but having to constantly re-plug this is not easy for some of us elders, so I am considering returning this and paying more for one with batteries. It's is great for bare floors, a bit sluggish on shag carpet though.

I bought this just to make ends meet for a project and I love it! Obviously you get what you pay for but it exceeded my expectations in regards to suction. My only complaint is the cord is not very long.

Good product to vacuum around small spaces and areas, where dust builds up, especially the small vents in my family's home. Very Compact and small, where it can be placed in the closet with no problems. Bissell has been good for consumers for decades and they live up to it. I have been using Bissell on and off since I was a older teen doing chores around the house.

Good little vacuum. Easy to use, clean and store. Only 4 ⭐ because the sweeper doesn't really sweep... it's best to just remove it and use the dust buster to get the desired suction. Good for small jobs like our RV.

reviewTitle: Box was open and item has scratches
reviewDescription: Box was open and item has scratches
Not a washable filter, clogs easily and $18 to replace.  Do like ease of use, lightweight and convenient. Love the headlight.  Battery runs out in about 20 minutes if using the high setting.

reviewTitle: Wonky vacuum from a name brand.
reviewDescription: I realize this style of cordless vacuum is very popular right now, but I prefer cordless vacuums that stand upright on their own without having to put screws in your walls. I felt as though the vacuum was powerful, but cleaning the filter and dirt cup was far more difficult than any other cordless vacuum I've owned.

reviewTitle: Trash catches in the door to the canister
reviewDescription: The trash is catching on the little door to the waste canister and dropping up causes waste to drop backOut of floor.
It’s good, but it constantly falls over and the handle falls off often. But for the price it does the job.

reviewTitle: Long hair wraps around the roller, has to be cut off.
reviewDescription: Easy to put together, easy to handle, and suction is good. One of the reasons I chose this vacuum was the anti tangle rollers.  "Cut the hassle, not the hair."  I used it once and had to cut my long hair out of the rollers. My large vacuum has the no tangle feature and it works well, this one doesn't.  I'm returning it.
The description over sold the product. I returned the vacuum because it was too light duty for my needs.
Works well for a while but then not much, especially on fur.. but does the job for the price.

Lightweight and easy to put together, this Bissell works really well on wood floors and low profile carpet. Does not do as well on area rugs (such as Ruggables) over a wood floor or light weight bathroom rugs.  The battery life is enough to cover about 800 sq ft well. Canister is  to empty and take apart to clean. Would be amazing for an RV.
NOT AS POWERFUL SUCTION AS I HAD HOPED FOR BUT OVERALL, DOES A DECENT JOB

This product replaced my swifter vac. It doesn't do everything the swifter vac did but atleast I don't have to worry about running out of charge as it plugs directly into the wall and the cord is very long. The dust container is very big too. I also like that I can use it on rugs even tho I have to say the suction is not good at all on rugs.I've had it for a few months now and still works great.

I’m very pleased with this purchase. The suction is impressive for the size— the high power setting is very effective at getting pet hair out of carpet. I have about 900 square feet to do and can usually get the whole space done on this setting. The handheld pet brush also works great on the sofa and bed.
It's a dustbuster type vacuumed with a detachable handle and intake. That being said, it's been great so far. Strong suction and easy to clean. Time will tell how sturdy it turns out to be.
This a great vacuum for small areas and floors I absolutely love it though it’s not the same as a large vacuum it will still get the job done at a fraction of the cost
This little vacuum is perfect for our daughter's dorm. It did a great job cleaning up the mess after move in and is easy to use and store. Does a good job for the price!

I was hesitant to buy this because the price seemed too good to be true and it looked like it could be almost too light/cheap, but man, I’m so glad I trusted the reviews. This thing has been a total game changer for me. I love that you can just use the handheld portion, or easily add the attachments to clean bigger areas and have it still work just as well. It’s super easy to carry/handle and the suction is so great compared to our old clunky vacuum. Highly recommend and will definitely purchase again if/when this eventually dies.

I’m so happy with my purchase! It works wonderfully. Assembly was a breeze and it does so much better than I could’ve imagined, even with corners and against walls/cabinets, under furniture etc. Love how lightweight it is and the battery life has held up well. I’ve been able to vacuum our entire home without the battery dying.
It came severely damaged so I sent it back.  But I did plug it in and it seemed like it had good suction and was very lightweight.  Will review when I get another.

I just opened this Bissell and am so excited to review it. First, there are 3 different uses. It has a hand vacuum which I find better than my Dirt Devil. Bissel has much more suction It removes dirt and debris from hard floors and carpets. Also, great for pet hair on upholstery. It's lightweight and easy to maneuver, with swivel steering that lets you navigate around furniture and reach tight spaces, ensuring a thorough cleaning experience. I highly recommend this for quick cleaning!
This is the absolute best vacuum for college students, its easy to move and not too loud. I cant believe how much it picks up when cleaning, and it leaves my floors looking great.

reviewTitle: Love this thing but buy an extra battery
reviewDescription: Great to do the entire house but larger homes will require a spare battery.  Not as much suction as the plug in large Bissell we have as well but does the job fine.  The LED's on the front really show you where the dirt is that you missed before you bought this vacuum.  One negative is when you use the wall mount the charger faces the wall so it's difficult seeing the LED's on both the charger and the battery to see it's charging or fully charged.  May have to add some foil to the wall to see the refection in We should have bought this sooner but got a great deal on Amazon's Prime day,  originally $229, on sale for $149, extra battery was around $50.

I love almost everything about this vacuum. It has powerful suction and can turn into a handheld! Amazing! I can do my rugs and laminate floors! Yay!But there is nowhere to put the tip attachment for edging, unless you know someone with a 3D printer. Literally, they don’t even sell an aftermarket version anywhere. Have deep pockets or carry it around with you. Ridiculous.

My fault for not reading product description carefully enough- but this is a CORDED vacuum. (Some blame lies with Amazon for suggesting this when I searched for “cordless” and with product photos that obscure the cord!) It had good suction and picks up stuff off hardwood floors. The head does NOT swivel - a swivel head would make it easier to vacuum - but it’s also not heavy so it’s easy to move it where you want it.

This vacuum is essentially a hand vac with a stick handle attachment. It’s great on hard surfaces (like kitchen floors) and has good suction; it does a fair job on soft surfaces and carpet. There are no rollers in the floor attachment, so it relies completely on suction to vacuum up dirt. For the price point, it’s a worthwhile purchase, especially for small jobs. But, if you’re looking for a vacuum for the entire house or for carpeted areas, I’d recommend something more substantial.

I use this vacuum in my basement on bare floors and low pile carpets. It picks up well. You have to empty the canister frequently, which I expected. The only reason for 4 stars is that there isn't anyplace to store the attachment, so I attached with rubber bands as seen in picture #2. I love purple but I don't think that a different color warrants the price hike, but all in all it's worth the price of the black sweeper. I would recommend, provided it continues to work. If anything changes, I'll try and remember to update.

I wasn't expecting much for the price, but I needed something for the little bit of carpet I have. The versatility of switching to  a handheld vacuum has been invaluable. It's easy to switch back and forth and easy to clean. The suction on carpet could be a little better, but it gets the job done.

This little vacuum is a beast!  I have a 2 story 3100 sq ft home with vinyl plank flooring and a few area rugs so I dont need a really strong wall to wall carpet kind of vacuum.  I've been using a microfiber sweeper and robot vac.  Sweeper would pick up a lot but inevitably push some dust around and the robot vac wouldn't always go where I needed to (would get there eventually but I don't always have time to wait for it to get there).  Doing stairs with the sweeper would blow the dust and pet hair around and can't use robot vac on stairs obviously so I was looking for a small, light but decently powerful vacuum.  Found it with this.This little Bissell vac has great suction for its size and is super light.  I  rinse the filter after each use (takes literally 2 minutes) and let it air dry.  Can be used as a had vac also if you take the handle off but honestly the size and weight makes it easy enough not to take the handle off.  It is on the shorter side which isn't an issue for me but a taller person may find that annoying.Gave 4 stars instead of 5 for length of the cord.  I added a lightweight 6 ft extension cord though and it's perfect.

I bought it by the fair price and also bc my aunt has another model of a Bissell vacuum that she loves and recommends, she’s been using hers for 5 years now. So because of her I got this one. Anyhow, I took this picture so you know it’s a small vacuum, but it definitely works well to clean up the house! If you’re on a budget like me, you should get it, if you can spend a little more, well, you should. LOL* The only thing I don’t like about this one is the fact that the head isn’t articulated, which makes it less funcional, you need to move the whole wand to clean up corners.

reviewTitle: Great for small spaces and stairs.
reviewDescription: This is the second one I’ve bought. One for my home and a second one for our rental. I use the home one manly for quick pickups or if company is coming to do a fast run around. The one at our rental is great for the loft area and the stairs as it is very light and also easy to empty the collection bin.

I hate dragging out my big carpet vacuum to touch up the living room rug when I see cat hair accumulating. Something light and easy to grab was what I needed and this vacuum is that. It is small and tucks into limited storage spaces around the house. It will clean pet hair off of the sofa quickly before your friends arrive. It can also sweep up the kitty litter kicked out around the litter box. Very simple to empty after each use. I do wish the battery lasted a bit longer. I find I can't do the whole house in one quick shot. That is not what I bought it for, but you can't blame me for trying! You do need to get into the habit of keeping the battery charged so it is on call 24/7. With pets, you never know when they are going to make a mess. And the Bissell CleanView makes a great cordless car vac too! This lighter-duty vacuum probably won't take the place of your main sweeper, but it will definitely fill in the gaps.
Gets the job done. Easy light weight !!!
Could clean better but great for small areas
Muy potente y práctico, al mejor precio
Works great even on tall carpet.
Wish it had a longer cord
Battery life is short
Lightweigh. Has good suction. Great on floors and low carpets. Incredible vacuum for a super price. I like Bissells program to support shelter animals too.

reviewTitle: Nice and light but it is corded!
reviewDescription: Has to be plugged in!

Overall, this is a good cordless vacuum for the price. The vacuum does have really great suction on the highest speed. Comes with good attachments for various jobs.The battery only lasts about 10 mins on highest setting, enough to get most spot cleaning done.I do wish the wheels had rubber padding on them, unit sounds cheap rolling across flooring.

I read the reviews and decided to buy this vacuum for dog hair, especially the hair that accumulates along the wall.  I was thrilled to see the hair disappear into the vacuum as I ran it next to the wall.  The suction was great; all I had to do to get close to the hair and it would be sucked into the vacuum.  It also seems to have a good capacity to hold the hair - with three dogs, that is pretty important to me.  The reason I gave it 4 stars rather than 5 stars is that the vacuum head is extremely small.  It is only 9 inches wide and when I want to run it in an entire room, it takes more time than I would like.  But I get good results and as long as I just want the perimeter of the room and maybe a little more, the time needed to vacuum is reasonable.  I would recommend this vacuum as long as you can supplement its use with a broom or larger vacuum.

It feels like a toy but it does have good suction. There is no roller like a real vacuum but it gets most of the dirt. I don’t think it’s getting the deep dirt but it’s good for a quick clean up. The debris cup holds about 1/2 c of dirt.
Not the best one out there but hey you get what you pay for!! For his price this product is amazing, It takes longer than usual and dont clean THAT GOOD but it does its work!

My biggest concern was the battery life. However, the battery is working well so far, let’s see what happens in a couple of months. The quality is phenomenal. They haven’t been any clog situations yet. The best part Is the lights that help you see all the little crumbs.

reviewTitle: Not too bad for the price
reviewDescription: Next time I will probably go with something better, though.

I bought one of these in 2015. I loved it so much I bought a second one in turquoise in 2024. The first one I could see when it was getting full. The turquoise had no window so I have to just remember to empty after each use. Very light weight and easy to use. Best for hardwood floors and died OK on rugs.

I'm not sure if it's only meant for a 2 min quick vac.. but if I last over 5 mins. On and off, the battery seems to get hot quick. It is super lightweight and I'm loving how easily I can take this upstairs, downstairs, and even on the stairs.  Just wish the motor was better. Battery also takes FOREVER to fully charge.

reviewTitle: Great vacuum but the battery life is not good enough.
reviewDescription: I love this vacuum. It's powerful & the swivel head works great. BUT, the battery life is not good enough. This is the 'Pet' version. If you have pets, you will always want to run this on the most powerful mode.You'll get 7-8 mins max in that mode.
We changed our flooring and needed something for our vinyl plank. I only get one  time around my living room and kitchen before the battery is on one light then it starts turning off.

It’s a good product, but I feel like this is the type of vacuum you should buy if you’re not quite ready to commit to a higher price vacuum. It is very light, had 8/10 suction, and is great for hard wood floors but didn’t do too well on my carpet/area rug/entry mat

reviewTitle: Very light, good for hard surfaces or every low carpets.
reviewDescription: Extremely light.  Has no beater brush, so only good for carpets you can use a broom on or floors you can use a broom on.  Works well.  Not too loud.  Easy to convert to hand held and easy to empty.

reviewTitle: You get what you pay for
reviewDescription: It’s an awesome little vacuum for small spaces or spaces that don’t need much maintenance but for your everyday use I would spend a little more. I have purchased two of these for small funished rentals and that’s perfect for me. It was super easy to assemble.

reviewTitle: Great suction, but flimsy, head doesn’t pivot
reviewDescription: For the price, it is a fair machine. It has excellent suction. I suppose it would be fine if you had a very small area of hard floors, but it’s too small and flimsy to clean any significant space.Good:- Inexpensive- Strong Suction- LightweightBad:- Short Cord- Head doesn’t pivot left and right (only hinges up and down), so unless you’re patient and gentle about turning, it lifts off the ground and loses suction- Wheels are plastic without rubber coating, seem like they might scratch hardwood over time- Handle feels like it could snap easily
I was surprised that this works so well.  When I took it out of the box I was skeptical, but it cleans the floors in my daughters dorm room perfectly and is easy to tuck out of the way.

I am on my 3rd Bissell stick. I now have a gray a green and a purple and am a little disgusted that none of them have interchangeable parts or filters or anything. I am not recommending Bissell anymore

reviewTitle: Makes a weird sound after a while
reviewDescription: I purchased this for light cleaning, dust, cobwebs etc. It is lite which I do like, but it feels like a kid's toy. The floor nozzle is cheap the only thing it does is make it push on the floor. There of course are no rollers except the wheels so you really need to go over the area multiple of times. As for the suction, not very well... I would not purchase again. I am disappointed that after the first use I have to drive to a location to have it serviced and fixed. :-(
Easy to assemble. Easy to clean. Doesn't really suction well enough to vacuum much up. It's more of a "toy" for my daughter to use while I use a better vacuum.
Con. Very short 5 minute run time on max 10 min on medium suction. Bogs down, stops on carpet. Pro. Lightweight, easy to empty. Good on hard surfaces

This vacuum cleaner is okay.  I used it on my wood floors and it picked up the dirt pretty good.  I also used it on 2 small light carpets and it worked okay .  I don’t like that it has vents on each side that blows out air while I’m vacuuming.  If the dust is spitting back out of those vents in the air and I’m breathing in that dust, that’s  not good and every time I bend down to do something while vacuuming, my hair blows around. .  It also doesn’t have a beater bar (brush) underneath which I hope does not scratch my wood floors.  The button to turn on the vacuum is too low on the vacuum cleaner and the cord is too short. The vacuum itself is ok to pick up light particles on wood floors and vacuum the sofa,  but putting the crevice tool  in the small hand vacuum and trying to get underneath my sofa and bed isn’t  working well because the crevice tool curves up slightly instead of being straight when you insert it. I wish the long wand could be used to vacuum under beds and sofas.  It does a fair job on my floors but I don’t like the above things I mentioned.  Not sure yet, but I I may be returning it for a better vacuum.

I’m very surprised people are leaving reviews that are so positive. That was why I bought it because I needed something for my travel trailer camper. I have two slide outs and they have carpet. I went over an area very well, slowly, overlapping, and thoroughly. Then I went over the area with my hand and had to laugh because there was so much dog hair this thing left behind it was quite humorous! This thing will suit my needs once I pull out a real vacuum that has a beater bar and more suction and clean the floor thoroughly. It did a fine job on the hard floors though. Another thing that I chuckled over was the size of the lint collector area. It has a filter smaller than a tennis ball and the dirt debris hair etc collect all around it. There’s a rubber flap that keeps sand, etc from falling out, but this has to be emptied every couple of minutes. This is a great little duct buster and for picking up crumbs, but if I had to use this to clean anything more than a few hundred square feet, I would definitely need more patience than I have, and I’m pretty laid back.To conclude, if you want a dust buster that can be used as a vacuum in a pinch on hard floors, this isn’t bad. But if you’re looking for a vacuum, this isn’t it.Edit: I couldn’t deal with it and bought another Bissell for 59.00. Soo much better, has a turbo spinner debris collector that holds 20 times the amount with a decent cleanable filter. It also has a beater bar on the floor attachment as well as a small spinner attachment for tight areas and upholstery as well as a brush on nozzle all on board. Now I have a real vacuum!
This works ok, but feels very cheap.  It feels like something my daughter would have played with as a toddler.  It picks up okayish.
This is all  plastic and not nearly as durable as other small vacuum I have  had, I wouldn't recommend except for very light use.

The Vacuum is working fine ! The picture show you the performance of the machine after 7 minutes of work!… looks like that little part is not working properly! The vacuum is very light and works ok if the filter is new! The first times 2/3 No bigger areas will be ok , the 4 time filter starts with the low performance and must be changed!… additional cost!Is good I recommended if you have just one pet!…

reviewTitle: Cord is too short but nice to small rugs
reviewDescription: I bought this so I didn’t have to lug out my big vacuum to clean up after my birds.  I have a wrist injury and the “lightweight” vacuums that have the motor at the top are painful to use. This one is super light, the motor is centered mid-way down the pole, and doesn’t cause me wrist pain.  However….My biggest complaint is the short cord.  This is ridiculously short.  I would have to have an extension cord to do my stairs because my house lacks outlets.  I dislike battery operated things for many reasons… but this cord is sad.  A few more feet would have made a difference.  Anyone who’s had to heft a heavy vac up and down the stairs will appreciate this is lightweight but for me, the addition of the extension cord is an added step, which is a hassle because I have to go get an extension cord from the garage whenever I need to do the stairs.  I’m not one of those people who loves cleaning.  Need to keep it simple and practical.  No extra steps and…  My cleaning closet is puny.This doesn’t have a super filtration system so if you have allergies be aware of that.  It’s got a very small containment cup. Do not expect to do your whole house with this… I have 4 dogs, 3 cats, birds, guinea pigs…. I’m abusive to vacuums.  I do not expect this vac to cope with a big cleaning job.  It’s for itty bitty ones at my house.It’s just a simple hand vac on a pole.  Light weight.  Good for very small rooms and small jobs.  It’s good for rooms with lots of furniture.  Getting a big vac in my daughter’s room is not practical.  Her room is narrow and it’s hard to get a vacuum in there.  This vacuum is not a work horse.  This would be good for kids.  It feels like a toy…. All plastic.I appreciated that it didn’t suck up my light floor rug and chew it up.  “Someone” in my house, ran the big vac over my brand new beautiful floor rugs and ruined them.  The head on this doesn’t have a spinning brush.  That is appreciated!I wish it had better wheels.  They are a hard plastic and I’m worried they’ll scratch my hardwood.That being said…. It works.  It fits in small areas.  It is easy to use.  Doesn’t ruin small rugs. The price point is good.  Just keep your expectations realistic.
Nothing moves the main attachment for floor doesn't move so you just vacuum  straight  it works  though  easy to accemble
I like the vacuums, but the cord is super short!  I had to re-plug it three times to do one room.
Easy to assemble but doesn’t suction well.  Cord so short so had to use extra one to clean around the house.
It’s a good vacuum for minor things. But, if you need to do major cleaning the battery life is awful. Very frustrating.

reviewTitle: Light weight, inexpensive, easy to empty, but weak
reviewDescription: This vacuum is no match for my cat’s long hair. My cat shed’s heavily. The vacuum picks up a little bit of his hair off the smooth hard floor, but picks up none of his hair off the not deep carpet. It doesn’t pick up loose kitty litter dust off the hard floor. It does pick up stuff like kitchen crumbs. It is light, quiet, and well priced.

This could be a great vacuum if only the battery wasn’t so bad. 8 minutes on high! For it to actually suck up dirt on a carpet, it has to be on high. For hardwood floors, medium power will work. Charging the battery takes forever!! I looked at getting a second battery and found the list price to be $59.99!!! The lowest I found it for was $44.99
I expected more from Bissell.  It doesn’t seem to be too powerful.  Bought on Prime day, so I’ll keep it for the price I paid

I got this for quick clean ups on my hardwood floors downstairs. I keep the regular vac upstairs now for the carpeting. I was tired of carrying the regular vac up and down the stairs so I took a chance on purchasing this little guy. It definitely is made for bare floors and not carpet. We have a thin area rug in the living room that I use it on and it seems to be okay, not great, but okay... but anything thicker no way. However on the bare floor it is great. It gets up all the dust and cat hair and crumbs. It is super easy to use and clean, super easy to assemble and disassemble. The only complaint I would have is that the cord is really short, at least compared to my regular vac, and I have to use an extension cord when using this unless I want to keep unplugging and re-plugging somewhere every few minutes as I move through the kitchen/living area.

reviewTitle: Great for a sewing room! I can’t believe what it pulls out of my carpet!
reviewDescription: This sucker is exactly that. I use it in my sewing room and on my Berber carpet . Man! does it pull up dirt and dust anywhere along with broken glass.  I needed something for my sewing room that doesn’t get the thread tangled around the roller brush. It gets all the thread and fiber off my floor and bits of fabric. I love it. It is Lightweight enough to be use by my grandkids and it doesn’t hurt my back. I can usually do two rooms before I have to empty it but if I empty after one room even I am so amazed  at all the crap it gets off my floor that I can’t even see!.

I keep these close to the areas with litter boxes. They have good suction, are easy to empty, and help keep the litter under control. We use them for general sweeping also. The price makes it reasonable to have more than one. Cordless may be more convenient, but these are easier in the long run and less expensive.

Takes two seconds to assemble. The suction is stronger than other more expensive vacuums I’ve bought. You only need to go over dirt once, maybe twice, and it’s gone. Also, it’s easy to switch from a handheld vac to a floor vac. I have tile floors, so can’t speak for how well it works on rugs. But for tile and wood floors, it’s amazing for the price.

So we had a samsung bag less with the extra accessory that sucks the dirt out and the thing never vacuumed right the head would stop spinning at the moment of any resistance and would require restarting the vacuum. It was a headache since day one. A week later and the issue is getting more out of the carpet and hasn't had one issue with the head.

Bought for a studio apartment with hardwood floors and it works great! Suction seemed perfectly good to me- when I used it handheld with the long nozzle to get in between some cracks in the floorboards, it picked everything up. Doesn’t tip over when in standing mode. Cord is a good length for the size of the unit; I had to plug & unplug it a couple times for diff ends of my apt, but that’s not a biggie. Filter was easy to access & clean. Only component that felt a bit cheap is the rolling attachment (used for standing mode). Just feels a bit lightweight & what normally is bristles underneath is a rubber strip instead. Still worked, just would prefer bristles.I have no idea why people talk about battery life in the reviews. Unless I’m missing something, mine is purely corded & it doesn’t turn on if not plugged in.

I bought this thinking it was a cordless vacuum and initially tried to cancel the order.  It didn't go through and I'm super thankful it didn't!  This is the little vacuum that could.  I work a veterinary clinic and I decided to bring this in to replace an older shopvac and I'm so happy with the switch.  It's easier to maneuver around with a decently long cord.  It may not be good for large-sized debris when in the standing vacuum mode -- but honestly what vacuum can really tackle that -- but for pet hair, thin material and normal dust or dirt this is a great vacuum to just whip around the floor once or twice.It's super lightweight and the assembly/disassembly to use the different modes is super simple.  I honestly can't believe how good the suction is for the weight and size of the actual vacuum element.  If you had to pick a downside it's about as loud as you'd expect a vacuum to be; and at least on tile it is also decently loud rolling across the floor -- but a vacuum honestly sounds like a vacuum so it's a minor nitpick.

This lightweight vacuum is great!!!! It has great suction-most importantly, but too is lightweight, easy to use, and an attractive little device. I use it in my office. I was surprised by its cleaning ability as it catches Everything. The filter is also great and an ease to clean. I HIGHLY recommend this vacuum!!!Too, there are a variety of other vacuums in the office and colleagues come to borrow mine. I love it!!!

reviewTitle: The joke's on me because I ordered this accidentally and it's great
reviewDescription: I browsed for a lightweight stick vacuum specifically to clean my carpeted stairs, intending to buy a cordless model since I don't have any outlets near my stairs. I clicked purchase on this due to the low price, realizing later that it is corded. I got an extension cord just in case.Fast forward to the arrival of the vacuum and WOW! This thing really sucks in a great way! It look hardly any time at all to vacuum 16 stairs and a landing. It's very lightweight and I had zero issues maneuvering it up and down.I emptied the dirt cup halfway through due to the level of Corgi and Cattle Dog shedding my stairs experience. Emptying the dirt cup was easy. Pop the latch, dump the cup, tap the filter, and you're ready to clean again in moments.

reviewTitle: Love this so much I got a second one!
reviewDescription: This is SO easy to use and clean. It's light, super effective, and works great even on hardwood floors. Instead of hauling out a heavy vacuum, I grab this and run it around my floors each evening (I have dogs and cats). Works great picking up fur and dirt. It's also light enough that I can just hoist it up and clean my return vents without taking them down. Love this vacuum so much I bought a second one!

This is the second time I’m buying this vacuum. I bought the last one six years ago, and still works, but some of the plastic pieces have chipped now, so just decided to replace it.We use this vacuum all the time and it does a great job picking up loose dirt and hair, even dog hair! I love the option of being able to use it with the handle or just as a hand vacuum and the different attachments. It’s easy to take apart and clean and doesn’t take up a ton of space for storage. Definitely well worth the price!

Product was used on tile and plush carpet with no issues.The suction worked better than I  expected for such a compact vacuum! Assembly is less than one minute.I also have a larger Bissell power that has a much stronger suction but this one definitely got the job done.I noticed my previous vacuum appeared to be losing traction and the photo shows what the lightweight vacuum picked up.My only regret is canceling an order for the same product for my mother.The weight is perfect for elderly or limited mobility adults.If you have grandchildren like she does keep a larger vacuum handy for tougher jobs.However,this one is great for daily tasks.

reviewTitle: One of my best purchases ever
reviewDescription: I’ve had this for over one month and every time I use it ( 1-2-3 times a day, sometimes), I love it more.I bought it because the area shown in the picture seems to be a crumb magnet. The broom just didn’t cut it and kind of a pain to get out my vacuum when I just want to do a quick sweep.Pros: so lightweight - I can pick it up with my pinky- picks up  everything( currently babysitting my grand dog( a shepard with sooooooo much hair)- quick and easy to assemble and empty filter( I saw some reviews say filter is too small. I frequently empty mine. I like to see how much vacuumed up- so- like I guess if you never empty it- it probably does get full🤷🏻‍♀️No issue for me- takes like 2 seconds to empty and put back in- easy to store-Works so well on wood floor, tile, low pile carpet( don’t really use it on plush rugs )No cons!!!) other reviews said cord is short. I don’t notice that but if I wanted/needed it longer, I would just add an extension cord. Lastly, I’m an avid review reader.This had great reviews and I can see why.I so love this product) next test is it will be traveling  with me to our beach house. If it picks up the pretty white sand as well as I think it will- I’ll be buying another one to keep there. )

In the last 10 years I’ve had a Dyson, Shark, 2 off brand cordless vacuums and now this Bissell. I would say I’m an expert on the cordless stick vacuum, and this is top of the charts!!I have a dog that sheds, so I vacuum daily. I chose this vacuum because of the pet hair attachment and it doesn’t disappoint! It works as well as the Dyson, and is substantially better than the Shark, for less than half of what either of those cost.It came with a nice variety of attachments, as well as a wall charging mount. The vacuum is sturdy, portable, and very easy to use.

Love this.  I use it every day.  Recommend you get the bundle with the extra battery.  Great for quick pickups, area rugs and smaller areas.  I use for wall to wall carpeted rooms too.  It's smaller than my full size vacuum so it takes a little longer but not having a cord is a big advantage.  Suction is great.  Cleanup is easy.  The pet attachment works wonders on chair cushions.  It really picks up the car hair.  Now that I have this, I can't live without it.

reviewTitle: 3 years in and still a great vacuum
reviewDescription: I bought this little guy back in 2021 and it's still going strong like the first day I got it. I have put it up against dirt, cat hair, dust, cat food and so much more. For how small it is the suction is great. I have picked up spilled cat food with it and it doesn't spell it when you pick it up like most other vacuums do. I would recommend it.If you have a small apartment and want something that won't take up to much space this vacuum is perfect. You can set it in a corner and pick it up when you need it without hassle. Cord is a great length. The ability to use it as a hand held is amazing.

We bought this last year when our daughter moved into the dorm. I was totally prepared for it to die during the year. She used it often and said neighbors borrowed it to do their rooms as well. It does a nice job, is lightweight and stores easily. Fast forward a year and said daughter has moved into an apartment. I gifted her my old Oreck (so I could get a new one.) In the meantime, I took this. It works great. I use it daily. I like that pieces snap off to make it a hand held. I just vacuumed under the sofa cushions. I can’t see it doing a great job on carpet, but for rugs and our hard surface floors, it’s been great!

I needed a lightweight corded vacuum to replace one I had for years. I've always had good luck with Bissell products in the past so after doing some research, I decided to buy this one.First, it's very lightweight which I love but it still has some good power to it. I plan to use it mainly for daily kitchen cleanups and I think it will be perfect for that. I don't think it's meant to be a whole house vacuum but for my purposes,it's perfect.It sucked up gravel, sand, dog treat crumbs, dust bunnies, lint and everything else that was on the kitchen floor.I'm really pleased with this little vacuum! I hope I can get a few years out of it.

This little but powerful vacuum surprised me! It does a great job & weights practically nothing. I got it to replace a much, much,more expensive cordless vacuum that I bought about 3 years ago & had problems with since the beginning. The charge wouldn't last long enough to do my family room until eventually it doesn't charge at all. Sure it was supposed to be more convenient being a cordless but I  give up & decided on this Bissell Featherweight instead & I'm so glad I did! Even if is not cordless, no fancy light or any bells & whistles but it sure GETS THE JOB DONE! I highly recommend it. Is my Quick Picker Upper for sure.

When I took the unit out of the box and saw how small it was I thought to myself this will never work. I plugged the little beast in and I was amazed just how much power it has to remove floor dirt and it being light made it a breeze to use too. I am happy with the unit. I did discovered that you need to keep the filter cleaned or clean after use.

reviewTitle: For light dirt this is great
reviewDescription: If you have heavy traffic dirt, or dried-on types of dirt, don't use this. But for light dirt this is great. It was actually purchased for my elderly mother. She constantly drops little items in kitchen and in her sewing room (threads, etc) and this picks it up easily while still being lightweight enough for her to handle and carry from room to room. And she loves the color!

reviewTitle: Floors, yes; thin rugs, yes; no heavy pile carpet
reviewDescription: This is very lightweight and portable. I needed something lightweight for my carpeted stairs so I bought this vacuum. I had a dog and it just didn't vacuum the fur at all. So, not recommended for carpeting.However, I moved into a place with rugs (think those washable kind that's all the rage) and it is absolutely perfect for those! And it works great on floors as well. It also works well on my stairs as I have the thin carpet squares on them.It's not for heavy-duty vacuuming at all, but perfect for smoother surfaces.

We were searching for a supplement to our cord vacuum.  We have 2 young kids that leave crumbs constantly EVERYWHERE. This gives me a quick little helper to manage their messes. Went on a cleaning frenzy with all the attachments to clean our upholstery, curtains, wooden blinds, stairs and fans.  So far the battery life has been as advertised. The only complaint is that the battery must be removed to charge and the charging light faces the wall.  A bit annoying, but a better design than other brands who have the battery built within. If the battery goes out, this one will be easy to replace.
Great little vac, only minor negative is a small cup to hold the stuff it pics up.  The vac head detaches to use as a hand-held.  Nice for the  price.

reviewTitle: So easy to us, So simple. LOVE it
reviewDescription: Just so tired of spending 200+ for the cordless stuff on here that quits working and is no longer here . This is just the most simple to use and so very inexpensive. LOVE it
The vacuum has a strong suction and can get into small spaces.  The only issues I have are the short cord and the head does not swivel.
Every product in this category has limitations, but this is a very well-made unit. It does pick up most items in the carpeting pretty easily and I would recommend itJohn J Hogan.
I was surprised at how well it cleaned for how small it is. Battery life is good. I like mine for my small area.
Does the job, not super powerful but gets the job done for light carpet cleaning in my hotel room turned apartment, small area

reviewTitle: So light and easy to use
reviewDescription: I love how light this little machine is... great for quick clean ups either as a vacuum or as a handheld dust buster.

Bought this because our family vacation apartment needed a vacuum that could easily pick up sand and dust and hair, but I wanted to spend as little as possible. This Bissell Featherweight was very inexpensive ($29.99 sale on Amazon USA) and so I didn’t have any great expectations. I was happily shocked at just how great a little vacuum this is! Its very powerful! It cleans up vinyl floors and low pile carpet very well. In fact, I just ordered another one for my home ($45 on Amazon Canada). If you need an inexpensive but good (and light weight) vacuum , I highly recommend!

Good for only hard floor surfaces and not carpets. There is no beater bar so it would be useless to believe it is effective o carpet.  It is very light weight and well designed for the debris cup empties easily without overflowing the container and can be rinsed and ready for another use. I use this in my kitchen for a quick floor sweep up.

I love the product. It’s small lightweight and it cleans everything up. They only part I don’t like about it is that it’s wired, but you can easily clean one room without having to unplug it and move it.

reviewTitle: Portable, Surprisingly Good for Its Small Size
reviewDescription: It vacuums really good, just don't use it on really thick carpet. if you're vacuuming up a lot of pet hair, just clean out the filter frequently, as it tends to fill up fast. Very portable, would recommend.

This is perfect for hardwood floors. It picks up all the pet hair and debris. I’m really surprised at how well it works. I have a robot vacuum and this one works waaayyyy better than the robot vaccum.

My other vacuum that's double this size, weight, and price only sucks half as good! Maybe you can get something with a more powerful suction if you spend another $20, but this is pretty dang powerful and so easy to throw around.I don't think I'll go back to a big-size vacuum ever again, but maybe I will add 10 or 20 bucks.

If someone were to show me this, I would die laughing. It literally looks like a kids play vacuum. However, this is perfect for getting the dog hair from my hardwood floors daily. The only downside is the cord is only 15ft so you have to keep unplugging and replugging to hit all the areas.I would definitely recommend spending the little bit of money and buying this. It's not a heavy duty vacuum and gets stuck on rugs. This is more like a hardwood floor, kitchen, and bathroom vacuum.

reviewTitle: It’s small and easy to use
reviewDescription: I’m happy to got it when I received the package my auntie told me it is small and easy to use in the colour this beautiful when I got it what I’m sure is my auntie told me it is the truth. Chris is really beautiful and small and it’s very fix for my small room to clean it myself use this Machine.

For a cordless vacuum it works well. In short it worked well as a vacuum, I have 2 Roomba robot vacuums that run everyday.  This vacuum still pulled dirt out of the rug.If you have 1 room or 2 small rooms this will work well.It is lightweight, has good suction on high, easily maneuverable, comes with wall mount to hang it. Battery is replaceable and you can purchase extra batteries since they snap in and out.Cons as far as I see them:It does not stand up on it's own, if you need to stop for a minute you have to find someplace to lean it on or hang it back up.It is not as wide as a regular vacuum.It does not charge while it is hung up, you have to remove the battery and place in charging spot.Collection container is small but usable if cleaned regularly.Overall for what I need it is fantastic and did I mention it vacuums well.

This is an awesome and powerful unit for it's size and purpose. No, it will not replace your super powerful vacuum cleaner but it will keep your tile floors clean.On occasion I will run it over my carpets for surface pickup till I lug out my REAL vacuum cleaner.Being elderly with mobility issues this is heaven sent.I definitely recommend it and would buy 1 in the future if for some reason this one dies which I really don't see it happening anytime soon.

This vacuum just.. doesn’t work well. It can pick up some spilled cat litter but that’s about it. Doesn’t pick up any crumbs from my carpet and it tends to just push around things on my hardwood, even the tiniest crumbs and hair. I don’t know why it manages to pick up cat litter and only that…Yes i’ve emptied it, cleaned the filter etc. Actually today I cleaned the filter and tried using it and the motor got extremely hot and smelt like something was burning within a minute- I’ve used the vacuum less than 10 times. Don’t waste your money

I got this to vacuum up cat hair from the living room rug. It is a flatweave rug and the only thing in my entire house that needs vacuuming since all  my floors are wood or linoleum. SUPER DISAPPOINTED that this doesn't pick up cat hair at all. So, guess I'm back to lugging my giant vacuum out twice a week just to vacuum up this 5x7 square. What a bummer. Also, I wish it was cordless. I'm going to see if it is still able to be returned.

reviewTitle: Spend a little more money to get a higher tier item...
reviewDescription: This is the plastic wrench your dad would give you when you were 5 and asked to help with plumbing or fixing the car. It's not a vacuum, it is a joke. Do not fall for the punchline of low price...  AVOID.This vacuum is designed for 1 room use. Like a craft room or a glitter room or whatever weird crafts you are into - that you do on hardwood or concrete.I purchased this to use as a replacement for a cordless Bissel Bolt Pet that had a dead roller. A new roller is almost the same price as this vacuum so I decided I would try a new machine out. Boy, do I have news for you...Cons-Cord length is a real issue. I thought I'd be ok with it - but it is so short. It is less than 3 Tom Cruise's...and that is short.-On/Off switch isn't on handle so you much lurch over or pick up the vacuum to turn on-On/Off switch is located exactly at the height of most things you want to vacuum under - like a chair - so you will turn off the vacuum just by using it.-No roller bar, so carpet and fabric use is sub-sub-sub-par.-Suction power ok - but not good. Like imagine a candy wrapper clogging it up. Not enough suction power to clear hair from the intake "valve" to the "filter" so you end up with a giant clump of hair that requires another dump out.-Limited filtering - definitely not hepa for my fellow allergen avoiding sneezers.-No rolling/tilt/swivel head - I guess I've never thought this was a feature I wanted, but it is. And you should too-Doesn't roll across floor as much as scrape across like an old Hotwheels car.-Doesn't stand on it's own for me.-Stick Feels so very cheap. If a robber broke in while you were vacuuming with this - it would not be a good option to deter. You'd be better off with a roll of paper towels or attempting some Indiana Jones moves with the super-short cord.Pros-$20 sale price-light-Hardly any moving parts to break (no battery to die, short cord that will always be in eyesight, no roller bar to get burnt out, no roller motor to die)-Makes your home to feel much larger than it actually is, because you have to unplug and re-plug it over, and over, and over. You must live in a mansion because you've unplugged it 8 times and you aren't halfway done vacuuming! Oh heavens, I might have to have a lay-down before I can finish. How tawdry of me and my vacuum.I guess I've not purchased such an entry level item before and have been let down by quality and functionality for the price.If you have ever been indecisive or even considered buying an expensive vacuum - this is not for you.If you think that you can use this until you are finally ready to pull the plug and buy a $300+ vacuum - this is not for you.If you have even considered any of the creature comforts the past 40 years have marginally added to vacuums - this is not for you.If you don't vacuum every other day - this is not for you.If you read Amazon reviews about vacuums - this probably is not for you.This is designed for children, but too loud for their tiny and sensitive ears.

reviewTitle: One of the weakest vacuums I’ve used.
reviewDescription: I’ve used a lot of vacuums in my life, from department store bargain vacs to $1200+ Kirby vacuums. This is by far one of the most disappointing vacuums I’ve used in my life. The suction is extremely low and it struggles to clean with multiple passes.I wasn’t expecting much for the price - I just needed something small and lightweight to clean hardwood floors. Despite my low expectations, I’m still unhappy with the purchase.The lack of a hose attachment is an oversight but can be forgiven for the price. They do include a crevice tool which is nice. I do wish it could be easily hung on a wall or a door but there doesn’t appear to be any simple way to do so.The two positive things I can say about this vacuum is that it is lightweight and it technically does work - but I wouldn’t recommend it. There are other lightweight vacuums on the market that will outperform this by a mile even if they are a bit pricier.

reviewTitle: Clogs up constantly and battery dies in a matter of minutes
reviewDescription: On a full charge, on the middle setting, this vacuum seemed to run for about 10 minutes. In those 10 minutes, I had to stop to unclog the canister about 3 times. When I am done vacuuming, a pile of dirt falls out of the bottom onto the floor. There is something wrong with this particular vacuum or its a design flaw. Dirt can't get into the canister without clogging it up every few minutes. It's very frustrating! I spent 200 dollars on this. I am returning the vacuum. I got a refurbished Dyson Cyclone v10 for 50 dollars more and I think you should just do that too! It's 10x better and the battery lasts longer. Don't waste your hard-earned money on this!

reviewTitle: Light and easy to maneuver, but terrible for pet hair
reviewDescription: I've only had this vacuum for a day, but my initial reaction is that it is light and easy to maneuver, which makes it particularly nice for stairs. It does not have as much power as a corded vac, but that was expected.What I did not expect was the terrible design of the dust cup. It has a very small capacity, but the real problem is that the cylindrical filter runs through the center of the cup, creating a narrow space all the way around that traps hair and dirt that needs to be pulled out by hand. Just a very poor design, particularly for something marketed for pet hair.

Purchased this for the carpet in our entryway. Needed something that could be stored easily. This definitely is right in terms of form, but not in terms of function. It reminds me of a child's play vacuum. It is that light and flimsy. Ok at this price point. It's useless as a floor vacuum on carpet.
