It may pick up some light items right on the surface, but if the carpet has any grooves, this little thing won't do anything. It's a handheld vac on a stick. That gives it greater reach, but nothing else. I'd pay double for something like this with real power.

Got this on July 25. It is now August 26 and the return window has closed so nothing I can do but! I actually really loved this and was using it a lot in the short time I had it and looooved it. Today while using it to pick up some crumbs on the couch it over heated and now won’t turn on. Sad.

The vacuum is light weight, the handle detaches easily to make a handheld vac.  The cord is too short, it's difficult to get the end off to put a different one on and there isn't a place on the handle to store the extra vacuum piece. Also, if you change the direction, you are vacuuming it makes a grumbling noise.

Not sure how this item has high reviews, it's VERY cheaply made and priced about double what it's worth. Suction is about half of what was expected, had to go back over with my Swiffer Vac to pick up all the debris left behind (if you've ever used a Swiffer Vac, those are about 2x as powerful as this thing). Absolutely NOT sufficient for a home with a long hair dog- my Great Pyrenees' fur overwhelmed the teeny tiny debris cup and I had to empty it 3 times over the course of the 1st floor of my home. Does not work on carpet- I have one very low clearance rug and this vacuum just balls the dog hair up on it and I had to go back over it with my other vacuum. Used it once and threw the thing away.

reviewTitle: Device broke with less than an hour of usage.  Bissell support has been horrible
reviewDescription: Purchased this for a gift, then held on to it for a month before actually giving to my wife for a holiday.  Small house, and used it a couple of times.  5-10 minutes per use at a time.  Left for a long holiday and upon return used it and it stopped working 2 minutes in.  Was past the return date for Amazon so I reached out to Bissell.  All went down hill from there.  Called, email and chatted.  Never had the sme person assisting me, they had me follow standard troubleshooting , like make sure the battery is plugged in, pull the on trigger to engage the motor.  They shipped me a new battery even though my existing and one form another of the same model with full charge did no twork.  And mine battery worked on another of the same model.  But they said that they could not verify I was using a good battery so I had to wait for it to get here and fail.  They they said they would send em a new device once I returned the defective unit.  Which I did. They then thanked me for it as they had received it and I should get my replacement in 3-4 bushiness days.  Fast forward 3 week and it still has not shown up.  They have been trying to close my support ticket as resolved.  I asked them for a tracking number so I could find the product.  To only hear that it has not shipped yet and will hopefully be back in stock in another 2 weeks.  Thus far horrible experience with this product and support.  I have a few other bissell products and have not had many issues, but unless they find some way to make it right (don't even know how they could do that at this point)  I would never purchase something from them again.

I purchased this vacuum on.  I ordered this vacuum on July 17.  I received it on July 24.  I didn't open the box until July 30.  I discovered a missing part and I immediately contacted support through Bissell's website.  On August 2 I received acknowledgment of my request.  On August 6 I received a response asking me to send a proof of purchase and my mailing address before my request for the missing part would be addressed.  I have since responded that they no longer need send me the missing part for the following reasons:I called customer support on August 5 at about 11 AM to determine the status of my July 30 request and to seek assistance with a problem I was having assembling the wall unit.  I was on hold for 36 minutes.  I finally opted for Bissell support to call me and I was promised I would not lose my spot in line.  It is now August 8 and I have not yet received a call back.  It must be a very long line.  Either Bissell customer service is understaffed or they are having an overload of support calls.  Either way, that does not speak positively about their products.I returned this vacuum on August 6 at the UPS office as instructed. As of Augusr 22 I checked the Amazon web site and confirmed that UPS has shipped the vacuum, but, for reasons unknown, they have not yet received my return.

I bought this vac because it has FANTASTIC reviews EVERYWHERE. I don't know how anyone would write a great review, because when I tried it, I had it for two days before returning it, for these reasons:- it is extremely top-heavy, so it feels like I am holding a heavy weight while vacuuming. My hand starts to hurt after a short while- the start/stop trigger is exactly where you grip the vac, so in addition to being heavy, you cannot get a good grip on the handle- it has weak suction- terrible design for the dust canister. Needs three steps to empty it (press the release button, turn the canister to unlock, press a button to empty)- and here's the kicker - it does not stand upright by itself.. You HAVE to install the wall unit, otherwise you'll have to lean it against a wall ... until it (eventually) slides off and drops to the floor- I returned this one and bought the Kenmore DS1030, which is not perfect, but is earth and sky better than this one

reviewTitle: This vacuum SUCKS (and not in a good way)
reviewDescription: When my former stick vacuum stopped working, this Bissell unit seemed like a reasonable replacement.  It wasn't.  I didn't like it from the moment I turned it on, but I thought I'd get used to it.  Two months in, my opinion hasn't changed.  First of all, it does NOT have a 40-minute run time.  Maybe 20 minutes.  And the thing simply doesn't pick up debris.  I have to go over small crumbs and pieces of grass several times before it will take it, and even then I often find a pile of pieces under the vacuum when I go to a different area of the room I'm doing.  I'm only using it on tile floors, so this makes no sense why it wouldn't work better.  I'm disappointed as I expected better from such a well-known brand. My advice: find another stick vacuum.  This obviously isn't Bissell's expertise.

Trust the reviews that say this thing isn't reliable. I bought mine on March 28th 2024, it is now August 20th, 2024 and it's completely dead. At first I loved this vacuum, it was a game changer. Slowly the touch screen display that allowed you to change the suction power for vacuum began to fade and flicker and no longer let you change it. Today the trigger wouldn't shut off the vacuum, I was forced to remove the battery while it was still on. I put the battery back in to try and restart it, it was completely dead. I charged the battery fully and tried again later on, still nothing. This insanely expensive vacuum only lasted me 4 months and 3 weeks.

This "vacuum" is basically a less-powerful, corded dust buster on a stick. The main reason I purchased this vacuum was to vacuum an area rug that has luxuriosly high-pile for which I can not use a regular vacuum with a beater bar.  It couldn't handle the rug, but I still thought it would be great for cleaning the floor mats that I keep in the doorways to the room with that rug in it.  The first time I used it, it did amazing on all three mats.  It's ability to clean the mats diminished with each subsequent use.  I emptied the dust chamber and throughly cleaned the filter after each use.  I've used it once or twice each day to clean the mats.  At first I could do all three mats and all the hard surface flooring near them and then clean the filter, but now, only a week later, it has to be emptied between each mat.  The level of dirt and dust on the mats has not increased, but the vacuum's suction has certainly decreased.  I've tried brushing the filter with a soft cleaning brush,  vacuuming the filter with my old cordless Black & Decker Dust Buster (which has much more power and suction than this one), and washing and drying the filter.  Nothing has made it work the way it did that first time I used it.  It's cute, but that's about it.  I'll probably put it out in my travel trailer or let of my grandchildren use it as a play vacuum.

I bought this vacuum a little over a year ago and I was quite disappointed after using it. I’ve worked with a quite a few vacuums but I am no expert, however, I don’t think it is normal for a vacuum to blow dust back at you, and this one does. We have cats and so we need a vacuum that can pick up cat hair and cat litter. If you have pets, this vacuum is not for you!; If you have allergies to dust, this vacuum is not for you. It took me several hours to get my living room crumbless and I even needed to go over it twice with the small  attachment to get it that way (which took forever). But if you have a small room that doesn’t get anything vacuum-worthy in it, this vacuum would suit you great!I don’t leave reviews for things like this very often, but I saw the product while I was looking for a new vacuum and thought the universe was telling me to warn you all. :)

reviewTitle: Battery only works 10 min and Amazon refuses to refund
reviewDescription: I purchased the bisel to use internationally (not in USA) and got it shipped to Central America.  The battery only lasts for 10 minutes and it stops. Talked to Amazon and I understand you need to return it to get a refund, but I cannot return it in another country without the shipping bein expensive, I might as well purchase it again!!! It might be cheaper.Amazon refuses to help me when all I need is a new battery!, they do not understand their international customers who cannot just easily return a product like if you live in the USA,Do not purchase

The filter clogs after 13 seconds of use. There’s like no room inside to hold what has been vacuumed. Here’s to be emptied every 40 seconds. Even as a fiction author I have some difficulty imagining scenarios wherein someone would want this vacuum. Perhaps if they owned a small hamster who inhabited a 12in but 30in enclosed area over hardwood floor and they wanted to vacuum it daily for him. This would work for that. Any more fur would clog the filter immediately. Since I can’t return it I will endeavor to find some use for it, but it will stretch my imagination to its limits and most certainly try my patience as I spend 15x the amount of time cleaning the vacuum itself than the area I needed to vacuum.

reviewTitle: Poor Quality... Do NOT buy if you want crumbs and dust removed from your carpet!
reviewDescription: This vacuum SUCKS (no pun intended, because it can't even pick up visible crumbs, lint, or hair).Highly disappointed. After reading the reviews, I thought this small vacuum would be good for an apartment of 770 sq. ft. and mostly hardwood (plus 1 carpeted bedroom, and small- and a medium-sized rugs). I was wrong.  It doesn't even pick up visible crumbs from the carpet and rugs. It has poor suction, a very small hole for suction, and no brushes.It started making this weird sound on the 2nd user that I have yet to resolve. I tried making sure it was tightly fastened and tried other ways to troubleshoot it. If I wasn't so busy during the time I bought it, I would've returned and requested an immediate refund. It also took an unusually long time to be shipped and arrive (Prime delivery) . I placed my order on Oct 1 and it was EXPECTED to arrive on Oct 4; however, it wasn't shipped until Oct 11 and did not arrive until Oct 13. I tried requesting a refund for it twice before it arrived and Amazon denied my requests both times.I also was in dire need of this vacuum because I was suffering from pet allergens from surrounding neighbors (I don't have any pets). I didn't have high expectations for it to pick up the allergens but did think it would pick up crumbs, lint, hair, and strings. Wrong. Mediocre job on hardwood. Poor job on carpet/rug.

Omg this is a dustbuster with a handle. Gets full very quickly and super ridiculously short cord. Would be great for a child to teach them how to clean!! Not for a house or apartment, just a small room with light needs. Makes a funny noise when it gets too full of dirt, and not easily dumpable dust bin. Returning!

The vacuum cleaner itself work very well. It’s sucky, in a good way. HOWEVER, the battery will only last 20 minutes. We bought the extra battery for it but still thinking about returning it. Also, it will not stand up on its own.
Not the best suction battery dies fairly quick, but good for quick pick ups of dust dirt grass and hair

Decent vacuum for the price but most helpful on floors and not on carpet . It needs more power for the use in carpet . Also would be good to have a built in battery so you can take it anywhere without needing to be plugged in all the time .
The battery may stay charged for 30 minutes after charging for hours. The container that holds what is vacuumed up is small and constantly gets clogged. Definitely not worth the money.

reviewTitle: Muy buena para resolver en el momento
reviewDescription: Es muy buena aunq en lo personal me hubiera gustado que el cabezal de abajo fuera más grande y trabajara con más presión pero en realidad para donde el sucio no es muy fuerte ni es para trabajos fuerte es buena de lo contrario necesitarás una más fuerte

I got this as an extra vacuum I could easily whip out to clean up minor spills but wow, this thing will absolutely not work at all on carpet even when I go over something multiple times. Does the job on hard floors.The whole design just feels ready to fall apart. The attachments (including the regular floor vacuum head) have nothing slotting it on, you just have to jam it on the end. The attachments stayed on alright while I was using them but it just felt awkward to change them around. Also prone to falling over. Cord is also a bit short.
It’s a nice product but i wish it had more suction, battery lasted longer, and it wasn’t as heavy

reviewTitle: The suction is not the best.
reviewDescription: It works alright on floors, but it really doesn't work well for the carpet.  The cup fills up fast, so it has to be emptied with each use, but it is light weight and is easier to carry than a heavier vacuum cleaner.

This is great for small spaces, I wish I would have gotten one that was cordless. This one also doesn't lock when it's upright so it falls down a lot. Suction is pretty good for hard floors, works for what I need it for.

The vacuum head went out after general use for two months; Pretty disappointed to be honest. I was under the impression that Bissell was a trusted brand. They only have a limited warranty which does not cover the vacuum head if the roller is not the only issue. When it did work, it was great. A good alternative to the Dyson brand; however we will be spending more money on a trusted brand with more than just a "limited" warranty.

reviewTitle: Vaccuum blew up and filled my apartment with smoke.
reviewDescription: The BISSELL Featherweight Stick Lightweight Bagless Vaccuum blew up and filled my apartment with smoke. I only had it for four months. I had to leave my apartment for the day to air it out and my apartment still smells from the smoke. I threw this BISSELL away. Do not buy this product.

reviewTitle: Won’t Pick Up Anything But Hair on Hard Flooring
reviewDescription: It goes together without a problem. However, I could not pick up cat litter or anything but hair and lint on hardwood flooring. We have a bird and two cats so we have bits and pieces on the floor all the time. I thought it was vacuuming but it merely scoots stuff around.

Bought for ease of use...it's OK for bare floors but it's got such a tiny chamber, you have to dump more than once sweeping an 8x10 room of tile. The suction is not good, leaves much behind. Buy a nice broom. Or spend a few bucks more on a different brand/model.

reviewTitle: Not Sure Why It’s So Highly Rated
reviewDescription: We’ve had this vacuum for a little over 2 months now and it’s headed for the trash can.  Immediate first impression is that it sounded anemiclly underpowered, even at the highest setting. We thought, well maybe it’s just quieter than our other prior vacuums.  We gave it a shot but we end up mostly just playing dust bunny hockey with it - moving piles around the house.  Not sure if we just got a very bad model or if the reviews are overstated but we’re back in the market again for a reliable and preferably overpowered vacuum.

reviewTitle: No charging dock. You have to take battery out and charge separately . Return refund takes 30 day !
reviewDescription: Lead you to believe you can hang in wall and charge. You must remove battery after each use and charge separately. When returning they do not refund you right away. They keep your money for 30 days even when they have your returned item. Terrible

Terrible quality, you get what you pay for. This vacuum died within the first 30 minutes of using it. I used the vacuum for a while, then turned it off to move some things around to continue vacuuming. When I switched the vacuum back on, nothing. I tried a different outlet, still nothing. I tried letting the vacuum sit for 10 minutes, thinking maybe the small motor got overheated or something, but after trying to turn it on again there was still no response. Don't waste your money on this cheep vacuum, it won't even last a day.

I bought this small vacuum for one room where my cat is mostly so I wouldn't have to bring my large vacuum up and down the stairs. But I wish I didn't cheap out and buy this. It is not worth the money doesn't hold together well. The bottom keeps falling off when I'm vacuuming. It doesn't have great suction and it doesn't hold much. Save your money and buy something better. It will be worth it! It is very cheaply made and a disappointing purchase. I would return it if I hadn't thrown out the box.

I have a single carpet that the Roomba doesn't do a good job of cleaning. Was hoping this would fix that but there are no brushes in the vaccum so it's worse. Not really advertised that it's suction only and there's no spinning brush.

Used this to vacuum apartment carpets. I smelled burning. Inspecting I don't see anything caught but I also can't see a visible belt either. No pets, not cathair, short carpets. Item is probably best for hardwood floors. Don't use on carpet.

I bought this thinking it would be great with the positive reviews it had but I was super disappointed the battery life is garbage I live in a very small apartment an I can’t even vacuum the whole thing before the battery dies , the suction power is also trash it doesn’t suck up well being it’s a pet vacuum. Don’t waste ur money

Unfortunately this doesn’t vacuum well, it’s constantly getting clogged and I have to stop, push the debris back through the vacuum and then continue. This is constantly, I wouldn’t buy again or refer.

I live in an apartment and I bought this based on the good reviews and thinking this was a good vacuum. This vacuum barely sucks anything off of the floor. I have a black cat and he sheds, I attempted to vacuum and it didn’t suck up any of his hair off the floor. Complete waste of my money and I’m very disappointed.

reviewTitle: It still smells after 2 months and…
reviewDescription: I don’t know what that chemical smell is, but I’m definitely contacting the company. Not sure breathing it in is safe. Also, it’s  just not that great at suction compared to others I’ve purchased. I’d have returned it if I kept the box but I guess I shouldn’t have assumed it would continue to smell toxic (thought it was “new” smell).
This product was bought NEW, and when we opened it we realized that it had been USED. The dust bin had hair and dirt in it and the filter was dirty! YUCK!

reviewTitle: This is basically a toy for a small child
reviewDescription: I was skeptical upon purchasing this because it was so cheap, but it got so many good reviews that I decided to give it a try. There’s no roller brush at all and the area where it supposedly sucks up the dirt is very small and has very little suction. Does not pick up lint or crumbs at all.

This is hands down the worst vacuum I have ever owned.  It has very little suction power and the vacuumed particles come right back out and scatter all over the floor.  I checked for clogs that might lesson the suction and there were none.  I believe the Bissell company is very aware of the junk they are selling.  I am happy that these days reviews can be left to keep other people from wasting there time and money.  Folks.......don't waste your $ on this junk.
This is by far the WORST vacuum I have ever had in my life. Battery life is barely 8 minutes and then takes HOURS to recharge. Do not waste your money!

This is by far the worst vacuum I've owned. The canister is too small - and if you are advertising for pet hair?!? I hate that I have to remove the battery to charge and that it doesn't stand up on its own when not in use. I wish I saved the box and returned it.

First of all is clunkier and heavier than some of the discount brands. The battery life is terrible. I live in a 350 sq ft studio and i can barely cover it before the battery dies and NOW, with full battery it turns off after 3 seconds on its own. I want my money back.
We returned it because it wasn't cordless
Works decent for a handheld vacuum but as far as on my carpet it falls apart and doesn’t really work

reviewTitle: Not what I expected. I returned it.
reviewDescription: It was too heavy for me.
The attachments are difficult to remove - suction on high power did not remove cat hairs - removable bin leaks dust when operating- too klunky to maneuver

reviewTitle: Vacuum feels like a child's toy it is so small
reviewDescription: This Bissel featherweight vacuum is plastic, has tiny wheels, wobbles as you roll it across the floor.  The cord is so short it cannot reach across the width of a bedroom.  The handle latch snags on things like a bed and the handle falls off.  The same bed also caught the power switch, turning off the vacuum.  It really is a sad excuse for a "vacuum".  It only holds the smallest amount of debris.  Think handheld vacuum with a skinny stick attached as a handle.  I thought the brand name meant quality, but I was wrong. On a positive note, it has a lot of suction on a hard floor, but the exhaust fan on the sides angle air up so it hits the user's face.  Seriously, don't buy this vacuum if you want to actually clean your floors.
Great vacuum battery is awful

reviewTitle: I think these are hit or miss.  My friend's was good, but mine barely picks up.
reviewDescription: I was excited to get this because I'm in a small place with hardwood floors and a couple 6x8 rugs.  My friend has one and I was impressed with its pick up power for a small lightweight vacuum.  Mine however, barely picks up anything.  The last time I used it, I couldn't tell any difference between the vacuumed and un-vacuumed parts of the rug.  It didn't pick up fuzz or nail clippings, or even those bits of notebook paper that flake off the edge when you tear a sheet out of the notebook.  I had a regular sized Shark before, and of course it was excellent at cleaning rugs, but was large and heavy.  It was still going strong at 10+ years.  But not really ideal for someone with only 2 rugs.Maybe this Bissel is very picky about what types of surfaces (and rug types) it works on.  My rug is pretty flat, where as my friend had wall to wall carpeting that was a bit fluffier.  In any case, this thing is going to goodwill.  I'm giving in and buying a more expensive one.  No point in using something that has pros, but can't do its main job.
Battery life is the worst!
The battery does not last long at all. Also, the suction is terrible. I was very disappointed with my purchase.
Picks up superficial stuff only

I purchased this thinking it would be great, and to have a quick way to run over the carpet quickly. I was surpised at how much the handle & weight is holding it. I thought the weight would be more in the head of the vacuum. Not so. Wasn't happy with it and sent it back. Don't recommend if you are looking for the same thing.

reviewTitle: It does the job but the bottom piece moves around to much.
reviewDescription: I’ve had this for a while now. It’s lightweight and easy to use. It will do the job but I probably wouldn’t buy again because the bottom doesn’t stay down for a good suction without being careful. I personally need something I can move quickly and this one is built to use at a slower pace. It’s small so it will save space.
Vacuuming a loft in my camper. This is just a hand vacuum with a handle
It’s not a very strong suction but after a few passes it definitely works

I was excited to use this for quick cleanups. It's really not that great, requires multiple passes and really just no where as good as my traditional vacuum. I wasn't expecting it to be exactly like it, but I wish it was a little better. I would have returned if I didn't toss the box and such

Product is OK, but I’m not sure what kind of dog care they’re talking about. It is very very difficult to get the dog out of anything with this unit.And the battery dies pretty quick you definitely the second batteryMaking it all difficult to return the unit so be aware

This vacuum was okay I’m not sure why it has as many good reviews as it does. The suction is okay at best. The battery lasts for nothing. It turns off randomly a lot. The canister is super small so it doesn’t hold much. Just not a fan at all so I returned it.
It worked for the first month and now doesn’t suck up very much.

😮 So upon the easy assembly of my vacuum cleaner 😉 I cleaned the bathroom mats and floors 🙂 then tackle the living room 😯 all went well 😀 then came yuck time 😐 what goes in must come out 🥴 clean filter 😯 had to wash filter 🥲all good!

It works well but has a 20 minute life span on the second setting. It also has a very high pitch emission and you must check the tank often to ensure it isn’t clogged. Not my best purchase. I wished I’d bought another brand but was too late to return.

Based on my experience, I find the product to be quite affordable and convenient for moving around the house, including going up and down stairs. While it may not be as powerful as a Shark, it does get the job done effectively. I've bought three of these over the years, and I believe they make a great gift for college students. Overall, I highly recommend this product for its portability and performance.

Love this vacuum, good suction, good battery charge time, goes into corners/under cabinets/edge of floor really well, however the battery died after 2 months which Bissell replaced entire item and fortunately a Bissell service center is 40 miles from me otherwise I would have had to pay shipping. I’ve had second one for 1 year and battery is dead. I’d buy another but for the battery.

reviewTitle: Good for hardwood floors, not carpet. Cord too short.
reviewDescription: This is a decent choice for quick cleanups, especially on hardwood floors. It's incredibly lightweight, making it easy to maneuver and perfect for everyday use. However, the cord is quite short, so I find myself needing to unplug it frequently to reach nearby outlets. It’s also not the best for carpets, even thin ones. Still, it’s a handy little vacuum for light-duty tasks and hardwood floors.

It some good suction easy to use , but the cord is way to short! When It comes to using the vacuum I don’t wast to constantly unplug and plug in my vacuum. I want to get it done. I don’t buy cordless for the same reason, I want to plug have constant power to get the job done. But otherwise good product .

reviewTitle: OK but the dumbest design for a holder I've ever seen
reviewDescription: The vacuum is decent and came with a complete set of attachments. Emptying the chamber often leaves dirt stuck at the entry point.The biggest problem is the bizarre design of the wall mount for the vacuum. The battery charger fits in a separate holder backwards. So, you have to remove the battery from the vacuum head, put it in to charge but you can't see any of the lights showing progress or when charging is complete!!Oddly, on the handle are three exposed metal slots which looks like Bissell originally intended to allow you to charge the battery while still attached by simply putting the vacuum head into the holder. That not only would have made sense but would have been user friendly instead of user hostile.

reviewTitle: Does a decent job. Not the best
reviewDescription: You get what you paid for. Not the best suction you’ll have to go over spots over & over again until it’s clean. Does okay on hard wood floors not very well on carpet. I give it 3 stars because it performs but just takes longer due to the suction. I say it’s best to spend the extra $30 on a better vacuum.

reviewTitle: Broken in shipping, works well for what was needed.
reviewDescription: Vacuum works well for what I needed it for. I needed a small Vacuum for one office and it does the job. Disappointed that it was damaged in the shipping process. The neck of the Vacuum was bent before I ever took it out of the box. Vacuum itself still works just have to Vacuum at an odd angle due to the bend.

This is great for every day cleaning.  It's basically a dust buster with a long handle.Fantastic on linoleum floors and cleaning around the loose litter that kitties toss around  if you are looking for a deep clean, this isn't it but great for every day main

I bought this because the reviews but it doesn’t have as much pick up power as I wish it did. I got it to use in carpet stairs and then for the hard floors, works okay but just doesn’t glide and pick up like I wished but will keep.

I bought this as NEW for my dad.  Amazon sent a USED one.  He cleaned the crud out of the filter and tried it.  He likes the way it works and did not want to go through the trouble of returning it.  I would have.

Light and eacy to use, but the suction power is not enough, maybe if you are using for pet hair, it might, but not for general use.  Also, I am not able to find a spare battery anywhere, why would they sell an item if you can not get a spare battery.  I DO NOT recommend this product, save your money and buy a better one

reviewTitle: Not a fan of this vacuum
reviewDescription: Poorly designed. You have to remove the battery to charge it, and you have to remove the dust pun from the vacuum to empty it. I have owned many vacuums and I have never seen a design like this before. Too much extra work and too pricy for what you get. My cheaper vacuums work just as good and are much easier to maintain.

This vacuum has no pick up power, and the battery does not last as long as it says. When it is wall-mounted, the battery charger is backwards so you cannot tell that it is completely charged unless you take it off I’m very disappointed, but it’s too late to return  I have had Dyson before, but thought I would save a little money and all I have done is waste my money. I will never buy this again.

Coming from a Dyson stick vacuum, highly disappointed with this product. 1. due to the recharging handling and 2. the battery life. Called customer service who said that that battery life is according to the specification and hung up on me. I would return it if I was eligible to.
For the money this product works well for like 2 years then the motor burns out. I've had this happen like twice with this brand & model vacumn.
The battery doesn’t last more than 24 hours if not being charged. When using full power on the vacuum, the battery dies in under an hour of use.

I like it for the most part, it does pick up dog hair and fine sand, and dirt off our wood floors. It will not pick up small rocks or small pieces or weeds the dogs bring in. It will plug up if there is too much long dog hair. *Edit* After owning this for a month I get more and more frustrated.  It plugs up easily at two points, at the head after the bar picks up the dirt and hair and where it is suppose to dump into the canister.  I have to manually pull everything out. This is not pet friendly as advertised.
vacuum literally has no suction power. do not recommend.

I wanted to love this product so much because we have it at my school and I use it to clean up my classroom. I bought one for my house and it is basically dying on me now I use it at home just to pick up little things here aand their crumbs or, my dog's hair my dog is a short-haired Boston terrier, and it is dying on me now.

I bought this based on the rave review Sorely disappointed There are no bristles on the vacuum head just plastic wheels  Have to run over everything multiple times to even suck up crumbs  I guess you get what you pay for

reviewTitle: Disappointed in suction quality and ability to pick up minor crumbs
reviewDescription: I have been using this for over 3 months now, mainly on my kitchen floor for quick cleanups. I am disappointed it does not pick up non-hair items very well. Everything else is as expected and matches up to the item description but this vacuum really only picks up my dog's hair, nothing else. I need to find a better stick vacuum that will pick up everything. For example, it won't pick up a small crumb piece of a lays potato chip even on the highest vacuum setting. Very disappointing.

I received the Bissell Cleanview XR Pet 300w on Tuesday , unpacked it, charged the battery for 2 hrs, used on  my new floors in my basement.  I liked it at first but thought it ran funny.  As I turned it off, the little bit of dirt that accumulated in the compartment fell out the bottom of the vacuum.  As I tried to sweep it back up the battery went dead! I used it for a total of 5 minutes!  I am so not impressed with this product and do  not recommend it.  It is now Wednesday. I am returning it!  And if I could give it a 0 rating, I would!

I purchased this to replace my Dyson. Immediately I returned. First missing one of the attachments. Suction is no good. Was suppose to be more powerful. It’s not. My Dyson does a much better job. I wanted a 2nd vacuum for my upstairs. I will get another Dyson. The most important part you should know. When you return you have to wait well over a week or so for a refund. It’s been over a week and it says by another half a week refund should be there. Too much of a hassle for a weak vacuum. Buy a Dyson, buy whatever but don’t buy this one.Update: they refunded me after 2 weeks. Still would not buy again.

I waited 2 months to leave a review.  This is total rubbish,  clogs up constantly with the littlest of dirt.  Small capacity,  and weak suction power.  I miss my shark.  Every time I attempt to use this I want to toss in bin.  Even the wall mount doesn't allow for charging with battery attached.  DO NOT Waste your money on this.  Can't use on area rugs,  barely picks up pretty hair.  Wish I had returned it.

I bought this for my daughter Christmas 2023.  We packed it away for her to take to college this year 2024.  We moved her in 1 week ago and the room needed vacuuming.  We used it two times on move in day and it stopped working.  Daughter tried to vacuum this last weekend and it would not turn on.  We tried fiddling, taking apart and putting it back together, resetting the fuses and it just didn't work.  I was extremely disappointed.

reviewTitle: Like a dust buster on a long stick
reviewDescription: Not what I was expecting. This is just a dust buster on a long stick. There are no brushes to help pick up dirt off the floor. There's a plastic piece that scrapes and then there's a hole that sucks things up. You'd have to sweep things into a pile with a broom and then use this to suck all of it up. Does nothing on carpet. The cord is short. Definitely not long enough to get you across a living room or a full size bedroom. Do not recommend.

reviewTitle: Worst vacuum ever…. Not sure why it has so many good reviews. It’s puzzling honestly.
reviewDescription: This thing is a piece of trash and I have NO IDEA why or how it has as many great reviews as it does. We just moved into a travel trailer/RV and will be living in it full time. I saw this and thought it was perfect since we really don’t have anywhere to fit a full sized vacuum, and we don’t even have that much carpet. I wasn’t even going to write a review on this but I just finished vacuuming and got mad all over again. :-) Suction power is a good 1.5/10 and I’m NOT over exaggerating at all. Using it as a regular push vacuum picks up almost nothing off of my carpet and just leaves me to think about how much dirt is still sitting in the carpets. I’ve been using the hand vacuum with the crevice tool across my entire trailer and that’s the ONLY way this thing does anything close to what it’s supposed to. The only reason I still have it is because we need some sort of vacuum and I don’t have the manufacturer’s box to return it in…. Also, as a side note. I LOVE Bissell, I bought their $50 vacuum and it lasted me 5+ years, I just had to throw it away right before I bought this one, and it wasn’t even broken just very very dirty. So definitely disappointed in this Bissell product, DEFINITELY DO NOT RECOMMEND. AT ALL. I’ll be buying the same vacuum I had before this one and just have to find somewhere to put it.

I threw the packaging away, otherwise I would have returned it. I ended up going back to a similar dyson, like I'd had for the last 7 years (same unit the entire time). Used this in the house every day for about 3 weeks until I'd had enough of no suction, stupid design of the wall mount (you can't see the charge level of the battery when it's plugged in on the wall!!!!!), and cheap build quality. It is also unreasonably loud.So yeah, save yourself the trouble... I've been super happy with other Bissel stuff in the long ago past, this one though, was a super huge fail.

I would understand paying $15 for this, but definitely not $30. This thing should be something you buy for your 11 year old to start teaching them about responsibilities around the house. The suction power is VERY low, i have hardwood floors, ceramic tiles, as well as a 8’ x 10x shag rug, and this performed ok on the floors and terribly on The rug. It ALMOST worked on the hardwood floor and ceramic tiles, however, if I missed the TINIEST particle (lets say a small crumb), and would back up the vacuum up over it, instead of it  rolling over the crumb and picking it up, the crumb would get stuck on the back of the vacuum between the wheels, and would just be dragged back, So I would have to physically pick up the vacuum  and run over the particle again, making sure I would only run over it with the front of the vacuum to have it pickEd up. So pretty much, the vacuum is ridiculous low, there is really no Space between the wheels and the floor so whenever you pull the vacuum back, anything behind it will just be dragged back, not picked up.  On the fluffy rug, this was an absolute fail. Due to what i just mentioned about it being to low, the wheels would just get stuck on the rug. I found i got the best use on the rug by not applying any pressure at all, which would allow it to roll on the rug, but because suction power sucks, this meant it wouldn’t pick up much . Also, on the rug, whenever I would drag the vacuum back, the wheels would get stuck almost each time, which would result in the front of the vacuum completely lifting because it is so incredibly light ( i guess the only good thing), and this is where the suction part is. Overall, not impressed at all, if anything, just disappointed because I could have gotten a way better vacuum for $30.

I read the reviews online and on here about this vacuum cleaner. I thought it would be perfect BUT no it only gets pet hair and crumbs up. It can’t even suck up gold fish or the thin little pretzel sticks it either gets clogged OR doesn’t even go up and stays underIt until you pick it up. I really wish I could return it for how expensive it is. DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY!!
does almost nothing. put it back in the box and did a return after trying it out. it will not pick up cat litter even slightly! i put  my hand under it and felt almost no suction. ridiculous. booooo

I bought this vacuum to help clean up cat hair and it’s not strong enough to do that. I have to put it on turbo mode to get even the slightest chase of sucking up fur balls and then the battery only lasts about 10 minutes which is only enough to do half of my apartment. Wouldn’t be as annoyed if it was at a lower price point and I hadn’t missed the return window by one single day. Definitely don’t get this if you have pets to clean up after, might be ok for picking up dust.

Battery life is even less than advertised on high. High suction barely gets dog hair off my hardwood floor, must go over multiple times on my rug. The dust cup is way too small for dog hair. I have to empty twice just in the living room. Basically, I wish I hadn't thrown the box away because this would be going back. Not worth the money, even at the Prime Day sale price.
Had it since April and it’s leaving marks all over my floor all of a sudden. Now I can’t use it at all without a black mark going across my floor. I’ve cleaned it and still happening. So frustrating.
I should’ve known when buying the cheapest vacuum on amazon it would do absolutely 0 work. I can say this probably is cool as a prop or on hard floors but on vacuums it’s DOES NOT WORK

Suction is poor…Throws debris around.  Battery time is short.  The worst customer service!  Called manufacturer..Cannot reach a representative…no call back.  Forever to get a response by email.Very disappointed.Dyson by far!
I like most Bissell products and own a few but this is by far the worst. Battery life is horrible, suction is not great at all. Incredibly disappointed that I wasted money on this product.
Great at picking up pet hair but you have to constantly empty the canister. Sometimes i had to empty the canister 3 times before i finished a room. Mine crapped out after only 4 months.

This is literally the worst vacuum I have ever bought, which is shocking because I’ve had good luck with  Bissel before, The vacuum only picks things up on its highest setting. The battery only lasted about 10 minutes because of it. I couldn’t finish vacuuming my 600 square foot apartment on one charge. The vacuum is light but feels cheap. This was a huge waste of money.

reviewTitle: Vacuum Sucks, but not like it should
reviewDescription: This vacuum sucked but I don't mean it could actually suck anything up, it just colloquially sucked.  Came with a dirty filter.  Cord is super short.  If you have dogs, this is not the one to buy, if you have crumbs, don't buy.  In fact, if you need a vacuum to clean things up, this is not the vacuum for you.  I think the dirty filter is what sucked the most.  I recommend buying the Bissell Zing Lightweight Canister.  Had one for 7 years before it stopped working.  It is what I am going to get after returning the sucky, or should I say, suckless, Bissell featherweight
Very disappointed in the suction. When I finish vacuuming and pick up the vacuum to put it away, some of the dust, dirt, etc. falls out of the bottom of the attachment and I have to sweep it up.
I only used to this item 3 or 4 times on a small 2 Bedroom apartment with a low Carpet. After that I could not get the battery to charge. I wished I had bought a different product.
Vacuum sound good and seem powerful but I bought it used and it came with missing pieces making it unusable. I'll be buying it new instead

reviewTitle: Most worthless vacuum I've ever purchased
reviewDescription: The suction power is awful, barely will even pick up lightweight cat litter on the floor. It turns off when you try to vacuum our low-ply carpet (will only work on hard surfaces). The battery is huge and takes forever to charge. I tried to save money, but that was my mistake. Will only ever purchase Shark or Dyson vacuums from now on. So mad I wasted money on this piece of junk.
Thus is a horrible vacuum.  I hate it.  If I had kept the box I would have returned it.  Save your money.  It has low suction, clogs easy.  Absolute waste of money.
It does not have good suction. I had to go over some areas several times then when it did pick up it released it back on the floor. Wish I had returned it before designated return date.
I have a 1600 square ft house. I can’t even get thru 3 rooms before the battery dies even though it’s been on the charger for 24 hours. This is an absolute joke. I will be returning

reviewTitle: Horrible battery life, defective?  Does not do a great on very low pile carpets. Wood floors, meh.
reviewDescription: I bought this to replace a Dyson.  I was honestly ready for a switch.  Unpacking it, I liked it.  Lightweight, easy to understand and put together.  I charged the machine overnight and expected to do a good job of vacuuming in the morning.  The machine lasts about 10m on a combo of middle and boost settings.  It just dies.  I feel like it's defective, and I am sending it back ASAP.  I tried another charge and ended up with the same situation.  If the battery worked and held a charge, I'd give the machine a 5-5 on a 1-10 scale.  It's a broom vac at best.  It claims to be a pet hair vac...it's really not. Disappointed.

I actually stopped vacuuming to write this review. I purchased this recently to use on my hardwood kitchen and dining room floors, just to get between the cracks and light kitchen messes. The suction is very poor overall, it couldn't pull up the dust/dirt from between the cracks. If you remove the bottom part, which is awkward at best, there is a little more suction (using it like a hand-held vac), but still not the greatest. Emptying it over the waste basket results in the contents floating through the air onto your clothes and all over the outside of the unit itself. It quickly loses suction when the collection cup gets even less than half full.Did I mention the suction was poor?The length of the cord didn't get me completely across the kitchen. Also, a cloud of dust/dirt blows out of it when you turn it on.I didn't have high hopes for this due to the low cost, but was honestly hoping it worked better than it does.Please note this is for smooth surfaces only, no carpet, which I knew.Bottom line: keep looking.

reviewTitle: Makes loud, strange motor noise. Power cord WAY too short
reviewDescription: I cannot get past a few feet of vacuuming before I have to unplug and use a closer outlet. I can’t finish a room without switching to 3-4 outlets. Plus, there’s a strange, loud motor sound that is not normal. Suction is mediocre on tile. It was an inexpensive purchase, so in this case, I guess you do get what you pay for. Crap.

It does what I wanted. To vacuum a thin rug that my regular upright vacuum was too powerful for.  A couple of things could be better. 1) there are not “brushes” to help pick up cat hair. They are more like a squeegee blade. 2) the cord of too short. The room is about 12 feet long. The cord didn’t reach more than 8 feet. I'm keeping it for spot jobs and the RV though the cord may be too short for that too.
Not enough suction, but I like the cordless factor for my elderly mother. There's no cord to trip over abd it's not as pricey as a Dyson.
I do like the light weight. The performance isn’t the best. Only purchase if you just want have a backup vacuum not really good for everyday clean up.
Not as strong as I thought it would be but it’s great for dog hair that hides in corners. Very light and easy to use.
Bought this for my camper and the suction is poor. It barely sucks up the fine dirt, let alone the rock and pine needles

It’s cute, it’s plastic, and it makes a little whee sound when you use it. Cat is only moderately afraid, mildly curious about it. It weighs nothing because it really is like a toy. That said, I just cleaned up my whole two-bedroom apartment, hardwoods and a few flat area rugs, in no time. It has no problem with suction. I don’t get a lot of dirt in here to begin with, though. No shoes in the house, one small, low shed cat, one fairly unmessy human. I looked at serious, grown up Shark and Dyson vacuums, and I had saved a few on my Black Friday list. I’m bad about reading one star reviews, though, and it made me anxious to think of spending all that money on something that might disappoint me in the near future. Instead, I used the couple hundred bucks I didn’t spend on things I like.  Plus, I can’t be disappointed in something I already knew wasn’t perfect. It does its little jobs just fine, I laughed while I used it, and it looks all cute sitting in the corner of my kitchen. I got the purple one, btw, which I highly recommend.
For suction only good for a little mess up without getting out your large vacuum.Would not buy it again!
I need an extension cord to use it and it doesn’t hold much dog hair before limiting the pick up.

reviewTitle: Good for the price and quite effective
reviewDescription: For a good brand and featherweight model it's pretty decent. It doesn't get alot out of my carpet and if you don't have extra filters u have to empty it alot to get the best suction power from it . The chord length is ok id wish it longer but maybe that would cause more tangles. It gets warm if u run it for a long time like 15 or more mins but I guess that's normal. The only real issues I have is to always empty the pan and dust off the filter which causes the dust to goes all over. I am still satisfied with my purchase . So far as I've only have been using this for under 4 months

It’s a car vacuum with a nose attachment so you can drag it around and stuff. It’s fairly powerful for what it is, which is its only saving grace and good for linoleum floors which is exactly what I have. It comes with 2 nose attachments, but if you attach one you can’t detach it to attack the other, which is incredibly frustrating

I was super excited to try this with all the reviews on it being such a amazing little vac. We were staying at a vacation rental for weeks and the one at the house was on its last leg so I said to myself, let’s just get this. I don’t know what people are vacuuming to leave such stellar reviews, but this was not it. The performance was so poor it couldn’t suck a string off the carpet. It was flimsy, the handle felt like it was going to break off, it doesn’t roll easy it just drags along the carpet and after about 30 seconds it started getting hot and making weird noises. I’m surely hoping I just got a lemon, but either way, I’m returning it.

This is the worst vacuum I’ve ever had. I have two corgis, which shed, and this vacuum is pathetic. It constantly plugs and have to vacuum an area 2-3x to get it clean… and that’s after unplugging it. We sweep and try to vacuum regularly and it’s still a pain in the butt. Spend a little more money and go with a Dyson-don’t cheap out like I did and try this dumb thing.

reviewTitle: Dog hair piles up in the head of floor vacuum
reviewDescription: Not impressed with this vacuum. I thought with the title of this vacuum, it would have been great for vacuuming dog hair. Once I received it, charged it for a few hours and started to vacuum, any pet hair just piled into the floor piece (largest piece) of the vacuum and got clogged within 2 minutes. I had to return this vacuum and I am back to square one with researching for a good vacuum.

reviewTitle: I was sent a used vacuum!
reviewDescription: First of all, the box the vacuum arrived in had obviously been opened and retaped.Second, when I tried using it, the vacuum picked up nothing from my carpet. Nada.Third and finally, when I went to see if there was something wrong with the filter, I saw that it was already clogged with dirt, and the dirt can was half full.I'm returning this item and continuing my search for a small vacuum that will work on my single office rug.

reviewTitle: Dustbuster on a stick with less suction
reviewDescription: I’m not sure why this thing gets so many great reviews. We bought it for our camper only to find the suction (even with the floor attachment off) doesn’t even pick up a pine needle without angling it just perfectly. Having the floor attachment on makes it essentially useless. We gave it a trial summer but even with changing the filter and emptying it frequently it’s terrible.

This is the most useless “vacuum” I’ve ever owned. I never write bad reviews but I had to stop vacuuming right now just to write this review to hopefully save people from buying this piece of junk. It does NOT suck up anything. I have a small 2-bedroom apt and when I use it I have to constantly clean out the bag about every 3 minutes when I’m vacuuming a room otherwise it stops working, so it takes forever to vacuum 1 room. You have to go over the same spot many times to get it somewhat clean. Then it often “burps” up everything you just sucked up, so now you have a like of dirt and dust and everything all over again. At best this vacuum kind of moves or pushes things around, but does not vacuum well at all. It’s exhausting and it SUCKS, but not in the right way. Save your money and energy and spend another $10 or so to buy a vacuum that actually works! You’ll be so happy you did

I bought this to clean a tile floor in a 10x15 room while deployed. Second time I used it - it overheated, what appears to be burned up lint or dust smoked out of it, and it’s smoking… it would seem if it can’t clean a small room tile floor for <2 min… that it is a bad product.

I bought this item because it was lightweight and it said it had good suctioning for pet hair. I have one cat and he is a long-haired cat, this does not pick up cat hair. I would not recommend this. If you have any kind of pets in your house. Now I have to buy another vacuum

Ordered this product because I wanted a wireless vacuum cleaner. Worked really well however the charge died really quickly. It did not last the time stated on the instructions. I tried using it one morning and the battery showed it was charged completely however it would not turn back on. Left it charging for 8 and still wouldn’t work. I cleaned out all the parts, emptied the trash, cleaned the filter, and still wouldn’t work. I was still within my return window so I decided to cut my loses and just return it rather than trying to go back and forth with the company for replacement part.

Just after a couple months of use the battery will not recharge. I thought the battery should have lasted longer than this being this is not a cheap vacuum. Works great but would not buy because now they want 59.99 for a new battery that will only last a couple of months. Find a different vacuum

reviewTitle: Works as well as the cost
reviewDescription: Too small to pick up much and the cord is too short. Not worth it to buy.

reviewTitle: BATTERY STOPPED CHARGING AFTER A MONTH FOR NO REASON
reviewDescription: Loved the Bissell and ease of use transitioning from hardward to ceramic to area rugs. Had it just a little over one month and the battery went bad and won't charge. Tried to order a new battery on Bissell website and OUT OF STOCK. It's completely worthless without a battery and wouldn't you know, it's 10 days past return date on Amazon. In the trash goes the Bissell.

I bought this vacuum brand new and after using it a few times it stopped working properly. The battery does not charge and when I attach it on to the vacuum, it stays on for 3 secs. Unfortunately, I will have to return it.
Would no recommend this product is does not suck it blows out more air than cleans. I tried all attachments on my couch still left pet hair behind.
I should have known as it's so cheap.It might as well be a toy vacuum.
I bought this in hopes dependant on all the reviews however I was unsatisfied with this purchase. It's super tiney and didn't suck up the debris.
It doesn’t work consistently despite having a full battery. It only comes with one battery, which lasts maybe 20 minutes. Would return it if I could.

Received product, opened box and there was dog hair on some of the pieces. Plugged in to charge battery, charged for 24 hours and it never charged. Tried charging several more time and vacuum will not run for more than 1 minute.

reviewTitle: Doesn't hold a charge at all!
reviewDescription: The attachments are great.  Suction is good.  But doesn't hold a charge for very long.  Doesn't hold a charge long enough to vacuum 3 rooms.Updated 7/1624: I would not recommend this vacuum at all.  Suction has declined and the charge has declined from bad to worse.  The vacuum is basically useless at this point.  Very disappointing from a Bissell.  I've owned many over the years.  This one is a waste of money.

reviewTitle: Battery life and suction is terrible
reviewDescription: Not impressed at all! Suctions was terrible and couldn’t even clean a whole room with a plush rug. Went for a Shark and was much happier.
There's a little rubber flap inside as soon as it gets remotely dirty it just starts vibrating and making all kinds of noise the suction ain't impressive. Pos. Buy something else

I have a dog, and I also have a Dyson. The Dyson dies after less than 5 minutes so I was buying this one in hopes it was going to replace my Dyson! I was very disappointed. Even on the max setting this thing barely picks anything up, and also only lasts about the same as my Dyson with the dying battery. So disappointed! Will be returning. Vacuumed 3/4 of my house and the collection compartment barely had anything in it. Do not buy!

This does not have the suction that is claimed. I have to go over and over the same spots so it takes twice as long to sweep my hardwood floors also does not work on an indoor/outdoor rug at all. And the cord is not nearly long enough, it’s worthless

reviewTitle: Lasted 11 mins, then spit everything out
reviewDescription: I have hardwood and carpet in my home, but mostly hardwood. This just pushed the dirt around and once I finally got it to suck it up, the battery died and all the dirt fell out when I picked up the vacuum!! UGH I JUST WANT A WORKING VACUUM!!

Very disappointed with this purchase. Ordered this vacuum “new” but received it without its original packaging and it didn’t even have the head of the vacuum. Charged for a new product but clearly sold an incomplete return item. Thankful I was able to return it big waste of time.

Way overpriced product. Weak vacuum hardly picked up anything.  Battery life was a blink of an eye. The sweeping width was like four inches. This was a major disappointment and let down. Gotta question all those good reviews. This one going back! Just a lot of plastic

reviewTitle: Shuts off after a couple seconds
reviewDescription: This thing worked for a month, then started turning off after just a couple seconds.  I’ve cleaned it and made sure it wasn’t clogged.  Nothing works.

The concept of this vacuum is amazing and I wanted to love it so much. But I purchased it in March and it is june now. So not even four months. The vacuum starts overheating and starts making a loud noise. It gets full very quickly. It’s more-so like a small hand vacuum for your car. Not meant to use for daily use. it’s a great idea but it’s very cheaply made. Short term use.

It just doesn’t work well. Turns on fine, noise is low, but then doesn’t actually pick anything up. I got it specifically for any cat hair or litter on the floor and it just pushes it around and doesn’t pick it up. Will be getting a refund

Ordered it new and first use With a fully charged battery - the power cuts off randomly. It was not clogged since I had not used it .It also did this the second time I used it. It  would work for a minute and then it would cut off. wondering if I got a used vacuum. It suctions great while it’s working  on hard floors and area rugs.  it didn’t do very well  on mats by the door. I had to return it due to the annoyance of powering off . Another annoying thing is after it powers off it takes a Couple of seconds to power back on as well.

It is VERY top heavy & the cannister is small so you can't pick up much before you have to empty it.  It seems like it takes FOREVER for the battery to charge. The bottom where it picks up is bulky & you cannot get under much with it. I bought it for the price but remember you get what you pay for.

I’m trying to figure out why this product has so many great reviews. It’s that reason I purchase this vacuum. It’s not good as you can see in the video it’s not picking up anything.I bought this because I have cat hair on my carpet. This doesn’t pick up the hair or even items which are easier to vacuum. I’m pretty annoyed and will return it for sure. I’m a bit tight on cash right now so I thought I caught a great deal for a pretty good item. YOU GET WHAT YOU PAY FOR! I dropped it at a UPS site the same day I got it. It’s only good for the floor. You can put your and by the suction you barely feel it so idk how this is suppose to work for an area rug.

Battery stopped charging completely after 45 days. Vaccum only works for 10-15 minutes now. No Bissel battery replacement available. Cannot return vaccum after 30 days. The only battery replacement option I've found is the same price I paid for the Vaccum! Bissel company won't respond to emails. This is the 1st Bissel Vaccum I've had trouble with. I'm very disappointed 😞
After 2 months of use it started to make a weird noise and that was the end of it

We have bought it considering the good rating and reviews. It really didn't live up to our expectation. Suction cup has nothing after using it for 30 minutes, I think this is due to the less powerful vacuum and the smaller suction window at the bottom. I don't recommend it buying.
Unfortunately I have to write this that the vacuumExpels a burning smell after 8 months. So I won’t be using it. Seems like after a while it’s faulty.

reviewTitle: I don’t know how this has such great reviews
reviewDescription: I bought this vacuum because of the number of five star reviews and to say I’m disappointed is an understatement. All I wanted was a solid vacuum and this thing can be barely qualified as a vacuum. The suction power is abysmal and I’ve given up trying to use it to tidy my floors as I end up having to sweep my wood floors and use a friends vacuum for my carpets and rugs. Not to mention the handheld attachment doesn’t reach corners at all as the suction hole has to be flat to the ground to work apparently.

Was really excited to try this out. Unfortunately, the suction is so light, I had pet hair that was just stuck to the front that I had to pull off and place vacuum head directly on top of pet hair to be sucked up.  Waste of money.

The vacuum broke after 3 weeks of use. I left for vacation and then it was over 30 days for a full return. I called Bissell after trouble shooting with customer service her computer went down and she was going to call me back, she never did. I called after a few days they told me that I’d get a label via email to send the vacuum back and I would receive a new one. ….. no email…no label!!!!!!  Terrible customer service.

reviewTitle: Very short battery, clogs easily, poor suction
reviewDescription: On a full charge, the battery lasts about 20 minutes. The suction is so poor that the dust canister is still nearly empty after many uses. I have to unclog the hose every few minutes. I only have 1 dog who doesn't really shed and I use this on a few medium size, low pile rugs. It's lightweight, but really weak.
